        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see

NAME
    Get-Pfa2Connection
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) List volume connections
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2Connection [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of connections between a volume and its hosts and host groups, as well as the logical unit numbers (LUNs) or NVMe Namespace IDs (NSIDs) used by the associated hosts to address these volumes.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -HostGroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      HostGroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -HostName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      HostNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. Enter multiple IDs. For example, `peid01,peid02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple protocol endpoint IDs and host names. Instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `ProtocolEndpointId`) must be set to one ID (e.g., `peid01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ProtocolEndpointIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `pe01,pe02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple protocol endpoint names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `ProtocolEndpointName`) must be set to one name (e.g., `pe01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ProtocolEndpointNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VolumeIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VolumeNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Get-Pfa2ContainerDefaultProtection
    
SYNOPSIS
    List container default protections
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2ContainerDefaultProtection [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of containers with its default protections.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.

NAME
    Get-Pfa2Directory
    
SYNOPSIS

    -AllowErrors <Boolean>

NAME
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryExport
    
SYNOPSIS

SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryExport [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-ExportName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of directory exports.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryPerformance
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) List directory performance data
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryPerformance [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes for each directory and as a total of all directories across the entire array.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Protocol <String>
        Protocol type. Valid values are `nfs`, `smb`, and `all`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolGroup <String>
        Protocol group type. Valid values are `block`, `file`, and `all`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of NFS policies that are attached to directories.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    (REST API 2.7+) List directories with attached quota policies
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryQuota [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of directories and the quota policies attached to them. Directories with multiple policies are listed repeatedly (once per policy). The directories without a policy attached are not listed.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique managed directory IDs specified. Enter multiple managed directory IDs. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. For example, `fs:dir01,fs:dir02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PolicyId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PolicyName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

NAME
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUserMember
    
SYNOPSIS
    List local user memberships
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceLocalUserMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupGid <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-GroupSid <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberId <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberSid <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of local user memberships.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupGid <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>
        Performs the operation on the specified GIDs. Enter multiple GIDs. For example, `4234235,9681923`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupGids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the group names specified. Enter multiple group names. For example, `group1,group2`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupSid <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the specified group SID. Enter multiple group SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupSids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int32]>
        Performs the operation on the unique local member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. For local group IDs refer to group IDs (GID). For local user IDs refer to user IDs (UID). The `MemberId` and `MemberName` parameters cannot be provided together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberSid <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the specified member SID. Enter multiple member SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberSids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) List group to management access policy mappings
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-RoleName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays access control settings for remote groups.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

        Performs the operation on the unique names specified. For example, `GroupRoleMappingName`. Enter multiple names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        This field has been deprecated.
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceTest
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) List directory services test results
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2DirectoryServiceTest [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] -Name <String> [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays the directory services test and displays the results. The test verifies that URIs can be resolved and that the array can bind and query the tree using the bind user credentials. The test also verifies that the array can find all configured groups to ensure the common names and group base are correctly configured.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

    -Filter <String>

    -Limit <Int32>

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified. For example, `name01`. Enter multiple names.
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none

        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    Get-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) List directory snapshots
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of directory snapshots, including those pending eradication.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Get-Pfa2DirectorySpace
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) List directory space information
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2DirectorySpace [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays physical storage consumption data for each directory.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Get-Pfa2FileSystem
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) List file systems
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2FileSystem [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of file systems, including those pending eradication.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.

        Aliases                      none

        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none

        Aliases                      none

        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. NAME

NAME

        Accept wildcard characters?  false
