        Performs the operation on the unique Fleet names specified.  This query currently accepts only 1 name.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      FleetNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see

NAME
    Get-Pfa2Host
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) List hosts
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2Host [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of hosts.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>

NAME
    Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) List host group performance data
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformance [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes of all host groups, displayed both by host group and by total size across all host groups. This data represents volumes that are connected to the host groups on the local array and stretched volumes connected to the host groups on arrays that are connected by synchronous replication.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) List host group performance data by array
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2HostGroupPerformanceByArray [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data is displayed by total size across all host groups on each array and by individual host group on each array. The displayed data represents the volumes that are connected to a host group on the current array and the volumes that are connected to a host group on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. NAME

NAME

NAME
    Get-Pfa2HostGroupTag
    
SYNOPSIS
    List tags
    
    
SYNTAX

NAME
    Get-Pfa2HostHostGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) List hosts that are associated with host groups
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2HostHostGroup [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of hosts that are associated with host groups.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

        Position?                    named

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

NAME
    Get-Pfa2HostPerformance
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) List host performance data
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2HostPerformance [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes across all hosts, displayed by host and by total size across all hosts. This data represents volumes that are connected to the hosts on the local array and stretched volumes connected to the hosts on any arrays that are connected by synchronous replication.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) List host performance data by array
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2HostPerformanceByArray [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data is displayed by total size across all hosts on each array and by individual host on each array. The displayed data represents the volumes that are connected to a host on the current array and the volumes that are connected to a host on any remote arrays that are visible to the current array.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    Get-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List hosts that are members of protection groups
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2HostProtectionGroup [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of host members that belong to one or more protection groups.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill Filter Description }}

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

NAME
    Get-Pfa2NetworkInterfacePerformance
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.4+) List network performance statistics
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2NetworkInterfacePerformance [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays network statistics, historical bandwidth, and error reporting for all specified network interfaces.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Get-Pfa2Pod
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List pods
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2Pod [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of pods that are stretched to this array.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.

NAME
    Get-Pfa2PodArray
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List pods and their the array members
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2PodArray [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of pods and the local and remote arrays over which the pods are stretched. Pods with realm members will not be returned. The optional `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the pod. The optional `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array over which the pod is stretched. (Deprecated) Use pods/members instead.)
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    None

    System.Object

NAME
    Get-Pfa2PodPerformance
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List pod performance data
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2PodPerformance [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O sizes across all pods, displayed both by pod and as a total across all pods.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Protocol <String>
        (REST API 2.13+) Protocol type. Valid values are `nfs`, `smb`, and `all`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolGroup <String>
        (REST API 2.13+) Protocol group type. Valid values are `block`, `file`, and `all`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

NAME
    Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceByArray
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List pod performance data by array
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceByArray [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Protocol <String>] [-ProtocolGroup <String>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays real-time and historical performance data, real-time latency data, and average I/O size data. The data is displayed as a total across all pods on the local array and by individual pod.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
