NAME
    Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceReplication
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) List pod replication performance data
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceReplication [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays pod replication performance data. The data returned is the real-time and historical performance data for each replication type at the pod level. Values include `continuous`, `periodic`, `resync`, and `sync`.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed.         Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

NAME
    Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceReplicationByArray
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) List pod replication performance data by array
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2PodPerformanceReplicationByArray [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays pod replication performance data, organized by array. The data returned is the real-time and historical performance data for each replication type at the pod level. Values include `continuous`, `periodic`, `resync`, and `sync`.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

NAME

NAME
    Get-Pfa2PodSpace
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List pod space information
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2PodSpace [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays provisioned size and physical storage consumption data for each pod on the local array.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.

        Position?                    named

        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Get-Pfa2PolicyNfsClientRule
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) List NFS client policy rules
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2PolicyNfsClientRule [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of NFS client policy rules.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PolicyId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.15+) If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique policy IDs specified. Enter multiple policy IDs. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    Get-Pfa2PolicySnapshotMember [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberType <List<String>>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of snapshot policy members.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None

        Aliases                      none

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberType <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `directories`. Enter multiple member types. For example, `type01,type02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberTypes
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.

        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Get-Pfa2Port
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) List ports
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2Port [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays host name, iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs), NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs), IPv4 address of the portal, Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs), and failover ports, including those that were discovered by Purity//FA and those that have been manually assigned by system administrators.

    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.

NAME
    Get-Pfa2PortInitiator
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) List port initiators
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2PortInitiator [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Filter <String>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays host iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs), NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs), and Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs), including those that were discovered by Purity//FA and those that have been manually assigned by system administrators, along with the array ports (targets) on which they are eligible to communicate.

    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.

NAME
    Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List protection groups
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of protection groups, including their associated source arrays, replication targets, hosts count, host groups count, and volumes count. The list includes protection groups that were created on the local array to replicate snapshot data to other arrays or offload targets, created on a remote array and replicated asynchronously to this array, or created inside a pod on a remote array and stretched to the local array.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

NAME
    Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroupPerformanceReplication
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List protection group replication performance data
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroupPerformanceReplication [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-EndTime <DateTime>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Resolution <Int64>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-StartTime <DateTime>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays the total number of bytes of replication data transmitted and received per second. The data is grouped by protection group.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EndTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Filter <String>
        {{ Fill Filter Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

OUTPUTS
    System.Object

DESCRIPTION
    Displays the total number of bytes of replication data transmitted and received per second. The data is grouped by protection group and includes the names of the source array and targets for each protection group.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill Filter Description }}

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Limit <Int32>
        Limits the size of the response to the specified number of objects on each page. To return the total number of resources, set `Limit=0`. The total number of resources is returned as a `TotalItemCount` value. If the page size requested is larger than the system maximum limit, the server returns the maximum limit, disregarding the requested page size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Offset <Int32>
        The starting position based on the results of the query in relation to the full set of response objects returned.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Resolution <Int64>
        The number of milliseconds between samples of historical data. For array-wide performance metrics (`/arrays/performance` endpoint), valid values are `1000` (1 second), `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For performance metrics on storage objects (`<object name>/performance` endpoint), such as volumes, valid values are `30000` (30 seconds), `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). For space metrics, (`<object name>/space` endpoint), valid values are `300000` (5 minutes), `1800000` (30 minutes), `7200000` (2 hours), `28800000` (8 hours), and `86400000` (24 hours). Include the `StartTime` parameter to display the performance data starting at the specified start time. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. Include the `EndTime` parameter to display the performance data until the specified end time. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. If the `Resolution` parameter is not specified but either the `StartTime` or `EndTime` parameter is, then `Resolution` will default to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -StartTime <DateTime>
        Displays historical performance data for the specified time window, where `StartTime` is the beginning of the time window, and `EndTime` is the end of the time window. The `StartTime` and `EndTime` parameters are specified as DateTime. If `StartTime` is not specified, the start time will default to one resolution before the end time, meaning that the most recent sample of performance data will be displayed. If `EndTime`is not specified, the end time will default to the current time. Include the `Resolution` parameter to display the performance data at the specified resolution. If not specified, `Resolution` defaults to the lowest valid resolution.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    System.String

    System.Object

NAME
    Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) List protection group snapshots
    
    
SYNTAX
    Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-AllowErrors <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Filter <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Limit <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Offset <Int32>] [-Sort <List<String>>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Displays a list of protection group snapshots, including those pending eradication.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique contexts specified. If specified, each context name must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, lists only destroyed objects that are in the eradication pending state. If set to `$False`, lists only objects that are not destroyed. For destroyed objects, the time remaining is displayed in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named

NAME

NAME
    Get-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTag
    
SYNOPSIS

    Displays the list of tags.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowErrors <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the API will allow the operation to continue even if there are errors. Any errors will be returned in the `errors` field of the response. If set to `$False`, the operation will fail if there are any errors.

        If set to `$True`, returns only objects from destroyed resources. Returns an error if the name of a live resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter. If set to `$False`, returns only objects from live resources. Returns an error if the name of a destroyed resource is specified in the `ResourceName` query parameter.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ResourceId <List<String>>
        A list of resource IDs. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ResourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ResourceName <List<String>>
        A list of resource names. The `ResourceId` or `ResourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ResourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Sort <List<String>>
        Returns the response objects in the order specified. Set `Sort` to the name in the response by which to sort. Sorting can be performed on any of the names in the response, and the objects can be sorted in ascending or descending order. By default, the response objects are sorted in ascending order. To sort in descending order, append the minus sign (`-`) to the name. A single request can be sorted on multiple objects. For example, you can sort all volumes from largest to smallest volume size, and then sort volumes of the same size in ascending order by volume name. To sort on multiple names, list the names.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
