NAME
    New-Pfa2Certificate
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.4+) Create certificate
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2Certificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Certificate <String>] [-CommonName <String>] [-Country <String>] [-Days <Int32>] [-Email <String>] [-IntermediateCertificate <String>] [-Key <String>] [-KeyAlgorithm <String>] [-KeySize <Int32>] [-Locality <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Organization <String>] [-OrganizationalUnit <String>] [-Passphrase <String>] [-State <String>] [-SubjectAlternativeNames <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a certificate object and specifies the valid time period and organization details of the certificate. A certificate can be imported or manually configured.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Certificate <String>
        The text of the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CommonName <String>
        The common name field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Country <String>
        Two-letter country (ISO) code listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Days <Int32>
        The number of days that the self-signed certificate is valid. Defaults to 3650. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Email <String>
        The email field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -IntermediateCertificate <String>
        The text of the intermediate certificate chains.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Key <String>
        The text of the private key. This field can only be specified when importing a certificate and key pair.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Keys
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -KeyAlgorithm <String>
        The key algorithm used to generate the certificate. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate. Defaults to rsa if not specified. Valid values when creating a new self-signed certificate only include `rsa`, `ec`, `ed448` and `ed25519`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -KeySize <Int32>
        The size (in bits) of the private key for the certificate. Default is 2048 bits for `rsa` key_algorithm, 256 for `ec` and `ed25519`. The `ed448` default key size is 456. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Locality <String>
        The locality field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Organization <String>
        The organization field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -OrganizationalUnit <String>
        The organizational unit field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Passphrase <String>
        The passphrase used to encrypt `Key`. This field can only be specified when importing a certificate and key pair.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -State <String>
        The state/province field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SubjectAlternativeNames <List<String>>
        The alternative names that are secured by this certificate. Alternative names may be IP addresses, DNS names, or URIs.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

NAME
    New-Pfa2Connection
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Create a connection between a volume and host or host group
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2Connection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-Lun <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <String>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <String>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a connection between a volume and a host or host group. One of `VolumeName` or `VolumeId` and one of `HostName` or `HostGroupName` query parameters are required.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -HostGroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      HostGroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -HostName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      HostNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Lun <Int32>
        The logical unit number (LUN) by which the specified hosts are to address the specified volume. If the LUN is not specified, the system automatically assigns a LUN to the connection. To automatically assign a LUN to a private connection, the system starts at LUN `1` and counts up to the maximum LUN `4095`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection. For shared connections, the system starts at LUN `254` and counts down to the minimum LUN `1`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection. If all LUNs in the `[1...254]` range are taken, the system starts at LUN `255` and counts up to the maximum LUN `4095`, assigning the first available LUN to the connection. Should not be used together with an NVMe host or host group.
        
        minimum: 1
        
        maximum: 4095
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointId <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) A protocol endpoint (also known as a conglomerate volume) which acts as a proxy through which virtual volumes are created and then connected to VMware ESXi hosts or host groups. The protocol endpoint itself does not serve I/Os; instead, its job is to form connections between FlashArray volumes and ESXi hosts and host groups.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ProtocolEndpointIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointName <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) A protocol endpoint (also known as a conglomerate volume) which acts as a proxy through which virtual volumes are created and then connected to VMware ESXi hosts or host groups. The protocol endpoint itself does not serve I/Os; instead, its job is to form connections between FlashArray volumes and ESXi hosts and host groups.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ProtocolEndpointNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VolumeIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VolumeNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    System.Object

RELATED LINKS

NAME
    New-Pfa2Directory
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Create directory
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2Directory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <String>] [-FileSystemId <List<String>>] [-FileSystemName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Path <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a managed directory at the specified path. The managed directory name must consist of a file system name prefix and a managed directory name suffix (separated with ':'). The suffix must be between 1 and 63 characters (alphanumeric and '-') in length and begin and end with a letter or number. The suffix must include at least one letter or '-'. Set `Name` to create a managed directory with the specified full managed directory name, or set `FileSystemName` or `FileSystemId` in the query parameters and `suffix` in the body parameters to create a managed directory in the specified file system with the specified suffix. These two options are exclusive.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryName <String>
        The managed directory name without the file system name prefix. A full managed directory name is constructed in the form of `FILE_SYSTEM:DIR` where `FILE_SYSTEM` is the file system name and `DIR` is the value of this field. `DirectoryName` is required if `FileSystemName` or `FileSystemId` is set. `DirectoryName` cannot be set if `Name` is set.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FileSystemId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the file system ID specified. Enter multiple file system IDs. The `FileSystemId` or `FileSystemName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      FileSystemIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FileSystemName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the file system name specified. Enter multiple file system names. For example, `filesystem01,filesystem02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      FileSystemNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Path <String>
        Path of the managed directory in the file system.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    New-Pfa2DirectoryExport
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Create directory exports
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2DirectoryExport [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-ExportEnabled <Boolean>] [-ExportName <String>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates an export of a managed directory. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryId <List<String>>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. For example, `fs:dir01,fs:dir02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ExportEnabled <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the export is enabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ExportName <String>
        The name of the export to create. Export names must be unique within the same protocol.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ExportNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    New-Pfa2DirectoryLockNlmReclamation
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create NLM reclamation
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2DirectoryLockNlmReclamation [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates an NLM reclamation, which is a system-wide operation that affects all clients, so only one may be in progress at a time. Attempting to initiate reclamation while one is in progress will result in an error. When NLM reclamation is initiated, all NLM locks are deleted and client applications are notified that they can reacquire their locks within a grace period.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>

NAME

SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.7+) Create a membership between a directory and one or more quota policies
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2DirectoryPolicyQuota [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a membership between a directory and one or more quota policies. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -IgnoreUsage <Boolean>
        Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create a group in management access policy mappings
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Group <String>] [-GroupBase <String>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesId <List<String>>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesName <List<String>>] [-ManagementAccessPoliciesResourceType <List<String>>] -Name <String> [-RoleName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates one or more groups in management access policy mappings.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Group <String>
        Group name that contains users with the abilities granted by the associated policies.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    New-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Create directory snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ClientName <String>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-KeepFor <Int64>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a snapshot of the contents of a directory. The `SourceId` or `SourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ClientName <String>
        The client name portion of the client visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the value of this field, and `SUFFIX` is the suffix. The client visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -KeepFor <Int64>
        The time to keep the snapshots for, in milliseconds.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Suffix <String>
        (REST API 2.4+) The suffix portion of the client visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the client name, and `SUFFIX` is the value of this field. The client visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. If not specified, defaults to a monotonically increasing number generated by the system.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,

NAME
    New-Pfa2Dns
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.15+) Create DNS configuration
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2Dns [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CaCertificateGroupId <String>] [-CaCertificateGroupName <String>] [-CaCertificateGroupResourceType <String>] [-CaCertificateId <String>] [-CaCertificateName <String>] [-CaCertificateResourceType <String>] [-Domain <String>] [-Name <String>] [-NameServer <List<String>>] [-Service <List<String>>] [-SourceName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates new DNS configuration with parameters including the domain suffix, the list of DNS name server IP addresses, and the list of services that DNS parameters apply to.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

    -NameServer <List<String>>
        The list of DNS servers either in the form of IP addresses or HTTPS endpoints. Domain names in HTTPS endpoints are not supported. IP addresses must be used instead. If nameservers begin with `https://`, then DNS queries will be performed over HTTPS. Otherwise, unencrypted DNS queries will be performed. Using a combination of nameservers that begin with `https://` and that do not begin with `https://` is not supported. If servers are specified with `https://` one of `ca_certificate` and `ca_certificate_group` parameters must be set.
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None

NAME
    New-Pfa2Files
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create a file copy
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2Files [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DirectoryId <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <List<String>>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-Paths <List<String>>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-SourcePath <String>] [-SourceResourceType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a file copy from one path to another path. The `DirectoryId`, `DirectoryName` or `Paths` value must be specified. If the `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` value is not specified, the file is copied to the source directory specified in the body params. The `Paths` value refers to the path of the target file relative to the target directory. If `Paths` value is not specified, the file will be copied to the relative path specified in `SourcePath` under the target directory. The `SourcePath` value refers to the path of the source file relative to the source directory. To overwrite an existing file, set the `Overwrite` flag to `$True`.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique managed directory IDs specified. Enter multiple managed directory IDs. The `DirectoryId` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the managed directory names specified. Enter multiple full managed directory names. For example, `fs:dir01,fs:dir02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Overwrite <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing object during an object copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing object, the copy operation fails. Required if the `source` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing object during the copy operation.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Paths <List<String>>
        Target file path relative to the target directory. Enter multiple target file path in a comma-separated format. For example, `/dir1/dir2/file1,/dir3/dir4/file2`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <String>
        The source information of a file copy.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <String>
        The source information of a file copy.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourcePath <String>
        The source file path relative to the source directory.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceResourceType <String>
        The source information of a file copy.  The source information of a file copy.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    New-Pfa2FleetMember
    
SYNOPSIS
    Add members to a fleet
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2FleetMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-FleetId <List<String>>] [-FleetName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberResourceType <List<String>>] [-MembersKey <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Adds arrays to an existing fleet. This API needs to be run from the array that's joining the fleet.  To add the current array to the fleet, specify its own array `MemberId` or `MemberName`, as well as the `fleet key` generated on any array already in the fleet. `MemberResourceType` is `remote-arrays`. The array's `ID` and `MemberName` can be retrieved with a call to `Get-Pfa2FleetMember /arrays` on the array.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FleetId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique Fleet IDs specified. This query currently accepts only 1 ID.

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -MemberId <List<String>>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MembersKey <List<String>>

        Required?                    false

        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}

NAME
    New-Pfa2Host
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Create a host and upsert tags
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2Host [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ChapHostPassword <String>] [-ChapHostUser <String>] [-ChapTargetPassword <String>] [-ChapTargetUser <String>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Iqn <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-Nqn <List<String>>] [-Personality <String>] [-PreferredArraysId <List<String>>] [-PreferredArraysName <List<String>>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-Vlan <String>] [-Wwn <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a host for which the `Name` query parameter is required.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ChapTargetUser <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Iqn <List<String>>
        The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) associated with the host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Iqns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Nqn <List<String>>
        The NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) associated with the host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Nqns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Personality <String>
        Determines how the system tunes the array to ensure that it works optimally with the host. Set `Personality` to the name of the host operating system or virtual memory system. Valid values are `aix`, `esxi`, `hitachi-vsp`, `hpux`, `oracle-vm-server`, `solaris`, and `vms`. If your system is not listed as one of the valid host personalities, do not set the option. By default, the personality is not set.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PreferredArraysId <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.
        
        reference: Reference
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PreferredArraysName <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.
        
        reference: Reference
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsKey <List<String>>
        Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.
        
        reference: NonCopyableTag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsNamespace <List<String>>
        Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.
        
        reference: NonCopyableTag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsValue <List<String>>
        Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.
        
        reference: NonCopyableTag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Vlan <String>
        The VLAN ID that the host is associated with. If not set or set to `any`, the host can access any VLAN. If set to `untagged`, the host can only access untagged VLANs. If set to a number between `1` and `4094`, the host can only access the specified VLAN with that number.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Wwn <List<String>>
        The Fibre Channel World Wide Name (WWN) associated with the host.
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Wwns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME

NAME
    New-Pfa2HostGroupHost
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Create a membership to a host group
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2HostGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Create a membership between a host and a host group. Adding a membership to a host group automatically connects the host to all volumes associated with the group. Multiple hosts can be belong to a host group, but a host can only belong to one host group. Hosts can be added to host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

NAME
    New-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Create a host group
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a host group member and assigns to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

        alternative API version

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

NAME
    New-Pfa2MaintenanceWindow
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) Create a maintenance window
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2MaintenanceWindow [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-Timeout <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a maintenance window that suppresses alerts for a specified period of time. A maintenance window can be manually closed at any time. The `Name` and `Timeout` parameters are required. Set the `Name` parameter to `environment`.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Timeout <Int32>
        The specified length of time that alerts are suppressed during a maintenance window, measured in milliseconds. The maintenance window timeout value must be between `60000` (1 minute) and `86400000` (24 hours). The value entered is rounded down to the nearest minute. The `Name` and `Timeout` parameters must be set together, and the `Name` parameter must be set to `environment`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    New-Pfa2Pod
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Create a pod
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2Pod [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-FailoverPreferencesId <List<String>>] [-FailoverPreferencesName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a pod on the local array. Each pod must be given a unique name across the arrays to which they are stretched. A pod cannot be stretched to an array that already contains a pod with the same name. After a pod has been created, add volumes and protection groups, and then stretch the pod to another connected array. Known issue: cmdlet claims to create pod with tags, however tag related parameters are silently ignored. As a workaround, use cmdlet Set-Pfa2PodTagBatch to create or update tags for Pod object.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowThrottle <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allows operation to fail if array health is not optimal.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FailoverPreferencesId <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.
        
        reference: Reference
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FailoverPreferencesName <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.
        
        reference: Reference
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QuotaLimit <Int64>
        The logical quota limit of the pod, measured in bytes. Must be a multiple of 512.
        
        minimum: 1048576
        
        maximum: 4503599627370496
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) The source pod from where data is cloned to create the new pod.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) The source pod from where data is cloned to create the new pod.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>
        Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsKey <List<String>>
        Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsNamespace <List<String>>
        Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsValue <List<String>>
        Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
