NAME
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Create a protection group snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a point-in-time snapshot of the contents of a protection group. The `SourceId` or `SourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowThrottle <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApplyRetention <Boolean>
        If `$True`, applies the local and remote retention policy to the snapshots.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.3+) Returns a value of `$True` if the protection group snapshot has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed snapshot is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed snapshot can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the snapshot is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ForReplication <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.4+) If `$True`, destroys and eradicates the snapshot after 1 hour.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Replicate <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, queues up and begins replicating to each allowed target after all earlier replication sessions for the same protection group have been completed to that target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ReplicateNow <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Suffix <String>
        The name suffix appended to the protection group name to make up the full protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If `Suffix` is not specified, the protection group name is in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `NNN` is a unique monotonically increasing number. If multiple protection group snapshots are created at a time, the suffix name is appended to those snapshots.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

NAME
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotReplica
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create an action to send protection group snapshots
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotReplica [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-ConvertSourceToBaseline <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates an action to send protection group snapshots to protection pgroup targets. When the `On` option is used, only specified targets will recieve the protection group snapshots.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ConvertSourceToBaseline <Boolean>
        Set to `$True` to have the snapshot be eradicated when it is no longer baseline on source.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation locally with the target names specified as the destinations of the operation. Enter multiple target names. For example, `targetName01,targetName02`.

NAME
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotTest
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create an attempt to take protection group snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshotTest [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates an attempt to take the protection group snapshot, without actually taking it, to test if the snapshot can be successfully taken.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowThrottle <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApplyRetention <Boolean>
        If `$True`, applies the local and remote retention policy to the snapshots.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        Returns a value of `$True` if the protection group snapshot has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed snapshot is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed snapshot can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the snapshot is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ForReplication <Boolean>
        If `$True`, destroys and eradicates the snapshot after 1 hour.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Replicate <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, queues up and begins replicating to each allowed target after all earlier replication sessions for the same protection group have been completed to that target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ReplicateNow <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Suffix <String>
        The name suffix appended to the protection group name to make up the full protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If `Suffix` is not specified, the protection group name is in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `NNN` is a unique monotonically increasing number. If multiple protection group snapshots are created at a time, the suffix name is appended to those snapshots.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Create an action to add a target to a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates an action to add an array, pod, or offload target to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array, pod, or offload target that is being added to the protection group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,

NAME
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Create a volume to add it to a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a volume member and adds it to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` parameter, and either the `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    New-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.4+) Create remote protection group snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-ConvertSourceToBaseline <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates remote protection group snapshots.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowThrottle <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.         Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ReplicateNow <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Suffix <String>
        The suffix that is appended to the `source_name` value to generate the full remote protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If the suffix is not specified, the system constructs the snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `PGROUP` is the protection group name, and `NNN` is a monotonically increasing number.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    New-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshotTest
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create an attempt to take remote protection group snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshotTest [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-ApplyRetention <Boolean>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-ConvertSourceToBaseline <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-ForReplication <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-Replicate <Boolean>] [-ReplicateNow <Boolean>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates an attempt to take a remote protection group snapshot without actually taking it, to test if the snapshot can be successfully taken.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowThrottle <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApplyRetention <Boolean>
        If `$True`, applies the local and remote retention policy to the snapshots.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ConvertSourceToBaseline <Boolean>
        Set to `$True` to have the snapshot be eradicated when it is no longer baseline on source.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        Destroyed and pending eradication? If not specified, defaults to $False.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ForReplication <Boolean>
        If `$True`, destroys and eradicates the snapshot after 1 hour.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -On <String>
        Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Replicate <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, queues up and begins replicating to each allowed target after all earlier replication sessions for the same protection group have been completed to that target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ReplicateNow <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, replicates the snapshots to each allowed target. The `Replicate` and `ReplicateNow` parameters cannot be used together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Suffix <String>
        The suffix that is appended to the `source_name` value to generate the full remote protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If the suffix is not specified, the system constructs the snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `PGROUP` is the protection group name, and `NNN` is a monotonically increasing number.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    New-Pfa2SnmpManager
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.4+) Create SNMP manager
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2SnmpManager [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Host <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Notification <String>] [-V2cCommunity <String>] [-V3AuthPassphrase <String>] [-V3AuthProtocol <String>] [-V3PrivacyPassphrase <String>] [-V3PrivacyProtocol <String>] [-V3User <String>] [-Version <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a Purity SNMP manager object that identifies a host (SNMP manager) and specifies the protocol attributes for communicating with it. Once a manager object is created, the transmission of SNMP traps is immediately enabled.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    New-Pfa2SoftwareCheck
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.9+) Create a software check task
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2SoftwareCheck [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-SoftwareName <List<String>>] [-SoftwareVersion <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a software check task. If there are no previously queued or running software check tasks, the new task immediately starts. Otherwise, it is queued and starts once all previously queued or running software check tasks finish. To create a task, use a software name and version.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SoftwareNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SoftwareVersion <List<String>>

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SoftwareVersions
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    New-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Create a software upgrade
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Mode <String>] [-OverrideChecksArgs <List<String>>] [-OverrideChecksName <List<String>>] [-OverrideChecksPersistent <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] -SoftwareId <List<String>> [-UpgradeParametersName <List<String>>] [-UpgradeParametersValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates and initiates a software upgrade.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Mode <String>
        Mode that the upgrade is in. Valid values are `check-only`, `interactive`, `semi-interactive`, and `one-click`. The `check_only` mode is deprecated. Use `/software-checks`. In this mode, the upgrade only runs pre-upgrade checks and returns. In `interactive` mode, the upgrade pauses at several points, at which users must enter certain commands to proceed. In `semi-interactive` mode, the upgrade pauses if there are any upgrade check failures and functions like `one-click` mode otherwise. In `one-click` mode, the upgrade proceeds automatically without pausing.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -OverrideChecksArgs <List<String>>
        The name of the specific check within the override check to ignore so that the system can continue with the software upgrade. The `OverrideChecksName` parameter of the override check must be specified with the `OverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, if the HostIOCheck check fails on hosts host01 and host02, the system displays a list of these host names in the failed check. To override the HostIOCheck checks for host01 and host02, set `OverrideChecksName=HostIOCheck`, and set `OverrideChecksArgs=host01,host02`. Enter multiple `OverrideChecksArgs`. Note that not all checks have `OverrideChecksArgs` values.
        
        reference: OverrideCheck
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -OverrideChecksName <List<String>>
        The name of the upgrade check to be overridden so the software upgrade can continue if the check failed or is anticipated to fail during the upgrade process. Overriding the check forces the system to ignore the check failure and continue with the upgrade. If the check includes more specific checks that failed or are anticipated to fail, set them using the `OverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, the HostIOCheck check may include a list of hosts that have failed or are anticipated to fail the upgrade check.
        
        reference: OverrideCheck
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -OverrideChecksPersistent <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>
        If set to `$True`, the system always ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check and continues with the upgrade process.  If set to `$False`, the system ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check until the upgrade check finishes and the upgrade process is continued. For example, the `continue` command is successfully issued in an `interactive` mode, or the first upgrade check step successfully finishes in a `one-click` mode.
        
        reference: OverrideCheck
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SoftwareId <List<String>>
        A list of software IDs.
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SoftwareIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -UpgradeParametersName <List<String>>
        The name of the upgrade parameter to be sent to the upgrade process.
        
        reference: UpgradeParameters
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -UpgradeParametersValue <List<String>>
        The value of the upgrade parameter to be sent to the upgrade process.
        
        reference: UpgradeParameters
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    New-Pfa2VchostConnection
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create a vchost-connection between protocol endpoint and vchost.
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2VchostConnection [-AllVchosts <Boolean>] [-AllowStretchedMultiVchost <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a vchost-connection between protocol endpoint and vchost. Each vchost is associated with a vCenter. Each protocol endpoint is associated with a storage container. A vchost-connection makes the storage container accessible to the vCenter when the vCenter attempts to mount the container. One of `ProtocolEndpointName` or `ProtocolEndpointId` query parameters and one of `VchostName` or `VchostId` query parameters are required. But if `AllVchosts` is set to `$True`, `VchostName` and `VchostId` should not be specified.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllVchosts <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the storage container represented by the protocol endpoint is accessible to all vchosts. Users should not specify `VchostId` or `VchostName` in the request. If set to `$False`, the storage container represented by the protocol endpoint is only accessible to the vchosts that have explicit vchost-connections with the protocol endpoint. Users need to specify `VchostId` or `VchostName` in the request.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AllowStretchedMultiVchost <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, users are allowed to create a new vchost-connection to a stretched container that already has a vchost-connection. In principle, a stretched container can only have one vchost-connection at a time.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>
        A list of protocol endpoint IDs. Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. For example, `peid01,peid02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `ProtocolEndpointName`. If the list contains more than one value, then `VchostId` or `VchostName` must have exactly one value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ProtocolEndpointIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>
        A list of protocol endpoint names. Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. For example, `pe01,pe02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `ProtocolEndpointId`. If the list contains more than one value, then `VchostId` or `VchostName` must have exactly one value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ProtocolEndpointNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VchostId <List<String>>
        A list of vchost IDs. Performs the operation on the vchosts specified. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `VchostName`. If the list contains more than one value, then `ProtocolEndpointId` or `ProtocolEndpointName` must have exactly one value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VchostIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VchostName <List<String>>
        A list of vchost names. Performs the operation on the vchosts specified. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `VchostId`. If the list contains more than one value, then `ProtocolEndpointId` or `ProtocolEndpointName` must have exactly one value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VchostNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    None

    System.Object

NAME
    New-Pfa2VchostEndpoint
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create a vchost endpoint
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2VchostEndpoint [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CertificatesName <List<String>>] [-CertificatesResourceType <List<String>>] [-Endpoint <String>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a vchost endpoint. Either the `VchostName` or `VchostId` query parameter is required.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VchostIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    New-Pfa2VirtualMachine
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.10+) Create a virtual machine
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2VirtualMachine [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-VmId <String>] [-VmType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates one or more virtual machines from a protection group snapshot. If the virtual machine is of type `vvol`, the `source` property of the request body must be a `recovery_context` value retrieved from the `Get-Pfa2VirtualMachine /virtual-machine-snapshots` endpoint. If `Overwrite` is specified, an existing virtual machine will have its volumes overwritten by the snapshot. Otherwise, a new virtual machine will be created from the snapshot. If creating the new virtual machine will cause a conflict with an existing virtual machine, the operation will fail.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <String>
        The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. `Id` is deprecated. Use `VmId` instead.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Overwrite <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing object during an object copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing object, the copy operation fails. Required if the `source` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing object during the copy operation.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <String>
        The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <String>
        The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VmId <String>
        (REST API 2.14+) The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VmIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VmType <String>
        The type of virtual machine. The only valid value is `vvol`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
