NAME
    New-Pfa2Volume
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Create or copy a volume and upsert tags
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-WorkloadConfiguration <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-WorkloadConfiguration <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-WorkloadConfiguration <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    New-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-Overwrite <Boolean>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-Subtype <String>] [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>] [-WorkloadConfiguration <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates one or more virtual storage volumes of the specified size. If `Provisioned` is not specified, the size of the new volume defaults to 1MB. (`Provisioned` sets the virtual size of the volume, measured in bytes. Volume size must be a multiple of 512 bytes between 1 MB and 4PB. Byte multipliers KB, MB, GB, TB and PB are supported, with no space between number and multiplier, such as `1PB`. Maximum value 4503599627370496.) The `Name` query parameter is required. The `AddToProtectionGroupNames` query parameter specifies a list of protection group names that will compose the initial protection for the volume. The `WithDefaultProtection` query parameter specifies whether to use the container default protection configuration for the volume. The `AddToProtectionGroupNames` and `WithDefaultProtection` query parameters cannot be provided when `Overwrite` is `$True`. For more information of creating volumes under SafeMode, run `Get-Help About_Pfa2Safemode`
    

PARAMETERS
    -AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>
        The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple ids.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>
        The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AllowThrottle <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allows operation to fail if array health is not optimal.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Overwrite <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, overwrites an existing object during an object copy operation. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the target name is an existing object, the copy operation fails. Required if the `source` body parameter is set and the source overwrites an existing object during the copy operation.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>
        (REST API 2.10+) Valid values are `+`, `-`, and `=`. The values `+` and `-` may be applied to volumes and volume groups to reflect the relative importance of their workloads. Volumes and volume groups can be assigned a priority adjustment of -10, 0, or +10. In addition, volumes can be assigned values of =-10, =0, or =+10. Volumes with settings of -10, 0, +10 can be modified by the priority adjustment setting of a volume group that contains the volume. However, if a volume has a priority adjustment set with the `=` operator (for example, =+10), it retains that value and is unaffected by any volume group priority adjustment settings.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>
        (REST API 2.10+) Adjust priority by the specified amount, using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator`. Valid values are 0 and +10 for `+` and `-` operators, -10, 0, and +10 for the `=` operator.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>
        Defines vCenter and EXSi host compatibility of the protocol endpoint and its associated container. Valid values include: `1`, `2`, `3`. When `ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion` is set to `1`, it's compatible with vSphere version 7.0.1 or higher. When `ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion` is set to `2`, it's compatible with vSphere version 8.0.0 or higher. When `ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion` is set to `3`, it's compatible with vSphere version 8.0.1 or higher. The default `ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion` is `1`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Provisioned <Int64>
        Sets the virtual size of the volume, measured in bytes.
        
        maximum: 4503599627370496
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>
        (REST API 2.3+) The maximum QoS bandwidth limit for the volume. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Maximum limit is 512 GB/s.
        
        minimum: 1048576
        
        maximum: 549755813888
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosBandwidthLimitReset [<SwitchParameter>]
        (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosIopsLimit <Int64>
        (REST API 2.3+) The QoS IOPs limit for the volume.
        
        minimum: 100
        
        maximum: 100000000
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosIopsLimitReset [<SwitchParameter>]
        (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Subtype <String>
        The type of volume. Valid values are `protocol_endpoint` and `regular`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>
        Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsKey <List<String>>
        Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsNamespace <List<String>>
        Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsValue <List<String>>
        Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WithDefaultProtection <Boolean>
        If specified as `$True`, the initial protection of the newly created volumes will be the union of the container default protection configuration and `AddToProtectionGroupNames`. If specified as `$False`, the default protection of the container will not be applied automatically. The initial protection of the newly created volumes will be configured by `AddToProtectionGroupNames`. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WorkloadConfiguration <String>
        The workload to which the volume is added. Set one of `SourceId` or `SourceName`, and `WorkloadConfiguration` to add the volume to the workload and configure it based on the `WorkloadConfiguration` from the preset the workload was originally provisioned from.  The workload to which the volume is added. Set one of `SourceId` or `SourceName`, and `WorkloadConfiguration` to add the volume to the workload and configure it based on the `WorkloadConfiguration` from the preset the workload was originally provisioned from.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WorkloadId <String>
        The workload to which the volume is added. Set one of `SourceId` or `SourceName`, and `WorkloadConfiguration` to add the volume to the workload and configure it based on the `WorkloadConfiguration` from the preset the workload was originally provisioned from.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WorkloadName <String>
        The workload to which the volume is added. Set one of `SourceId` or `SourceName`, and `WorkloadConfiguration` to add the volume to the workload and configure it based on the `WorkloadConfiguration` from the preset the workload was originally provisioned from.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

NAME
    New-Pfa2VolumeGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Create a volume group and upsert tags.
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    New-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagsKey <List<String>>] [-TagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagsValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a volume group. The volume group itself does not contain any meaningful content; instead, it acts as a container that is used to organize volumes. Once a volume group has been created, volumes can be created inside the volume group or moved into and out of the volume group.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>
        (REST API 2.10+) Valid values are `+`, `-`, and `=`. The values `+` and `-` may be applied to volumes and volume groups to reflect the relative importance of their workloads. Volumes and volume groups can be assigned a priority adjustment of -10, 0, or +10. In addition, volumes can be assigned values of =-10, =0, or =+10. Volumes with settings of -10, 0, +10 can be modified by the priority adjustment setting of a volume group that contains the volume. However, if a volume has a priority adjustment set with the `=` operator (for example, =+10), it retains that value and is unaffected by any volume group priority adjustment settings.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>
        (REST API 2.10+) Adjust priority by the specified amount, using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator`. Valid values are 0 and +10 for `+` and `-` operators, -10, 0, and +10 for the `=` operator.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>
        (REST API 2.3+) The maximum QoS bandwidth limit for the volume. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Maximum limit is 512 GB/s.
        
        minimum: 1048576
        
        maximum: 549755813888
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosBandwidthLimitReset [<SwitchParameter>]
        (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume group.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosIopsLimit <Int64>
        (REST API 2.3+) The QoS IOPs limit for the volume.
        
        minimum: 100
        
        maximum: 100000000
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosIopsLimitReset [<SwitchParameter>]
        (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume group.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>
        Specifies whether or not to include the tag when copying the parent resource. If set to `$True`, the tag is included in resource copying. If set to `$False`, the tag is not included. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsKey <List<String>>
        Key of the tag. Supports up to 64 Unicode characters.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsNamespace <List<String>>
        Optional namespace of the tag. Namespace identifies the category of the tag. Omitting the namespace defaults to the namespace `default`. The `pure*` namespaces are reserved for plugins and integration partners. It is recommended that customers avoid using reserved namespaces.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TagsValue <List<String>>
        Value of the tag. Supports up to 256 Unicode characters.
        
        reference: Tag
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    System.String

NAME
    New-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Create a volume and add it to a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a volume member and adds it to a protection group. Members that are already in the protection group are not affected. For asynchronous replication, only members of the same type can belong to a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` and only one of `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    None

    System.Object

NAME
    New-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Create a volume snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-AllowThrottle <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-On <String>] [-SourceId <List<String>>] [-SourceName <List<String>>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a point-in-time snapshot of the contents of a volume. The `SourceId` or `SourceName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllowThrottle <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allows snapshot to fail if array health is not optimal.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -On <String>
        Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source ID specified. Enter multiple source IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the source name specified. Enter multiple source names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Suffix <String>
        The suffix that is appended to the `source_name` value to generate the full volume snapshot name in the form `VOL.SUFFIX`. If the suffix is not specified, the system constructs the snapshot name in the form `VOL.NNN`, where `VOL` is the volume name, and `NNN` is a monotonically increasing number.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME

    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version

        Aliases                      none

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    New-Pfa2WorkloadPlacementRecommendation
    
SYNOPSIS
    Create a request for a workload placement recommendation.
    
    
SYNTAX
    New-Pfa2WorkloadPlacementRecommendation [-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesId <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesName <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesResourceType <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsId <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsName <List<String>>] [-AdditionalConstraintsTargetsResourceType <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-ParametersName <List<String>>] [-ParametersValueBoolean <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-ParametersValueInteger <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersValueResourceReferenceId <List<String>>] [-ParametersValueResourceReferenceName <List<String>>] [-ParametersValueResourceReferenceResourceType <List<String>>] [-ParametersValueString <List<String>>] [-PlacementNames <List<String>>] [-PresetIds <List<String>>] [-PresetNames <List<String>>] [-ProjectionMonths <Int32>] [-ResultsLimit <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Creates a recommendation for the placement of the specified workload. The computation might take a few minutes.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesId <List<String>>
        ">A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AdditionalConstraintsRequiredResourceReferencesAllowedValuesResourceType <List<String>>
        ">Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AdditionalConstraintsTargetsId <List<String>>

        Aliases                      none

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Array
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.4+) Delete an array
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2Array [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-EradicateAllData <Boolean>] [-FactoryResetToken <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes an array. For physical appliances, deleting an array restores the hardware to factory settings. This entails deleting all data, metadata, configuration, and logs. The array returns to the state it was in prior to any configuration changes being made. If the hardware is reused, it must be as a different array with a new ID. For virtual appliances, deleting an array puts it into an unusable state. Virtual resources (e.g., virtual machines) can later be freed, which deletes any remaining data, metadata, configuration, and logs. Prior to factory reset, an array must be manually prepared (e.g., all volumes and snapshots must be eradicated) and a factory reset token must be created.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EradicateAllData <Boolean>
        Set to `$True` to perform a factory reset.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FactoryResetToken <Int64>
        A token required to perform a factory reset.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Connection
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Delete a connection between a volume and its host or host group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2Connection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-HostGroupName <List<String>>] [-HostName <List<String>>] [-VolumeId <List<String>>] [-VolumeName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes the connection between a volume and its associated host or host group. One of `VolumeName` or `VolumeId` and one of `HostName` or `HostGroupName` query parameters are required.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -HostGroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the host group specified. Enter multiple names. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host group names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostGroupName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `hgroup01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      HostGroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -HostName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the hosts specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `host01,host02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple host names and volume names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `HostName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `host01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      HostNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the specified volume. Enter multiple ids. For example, `vol01id,vol02id`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple IDs. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume IDs and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeId`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01id`). Only one of the two between `VolumeName` and `VolumeId` may be used at a time.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VolumeIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the volume specified. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`. A request cannot include a mix of multiple objects with multiple names. For example, a request cannot include a mix of multiple volume names and host names; instead, at least one of the objects (e.g., `VolumeName`) must be set to only one name (e.g., `vol01`).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VolumeNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Directory
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Delete managed directories
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2Directory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes one or more managed directories. To be deleted, a managed directory must be empty and not attached to any enabled export policies. Deleted managed directories cannot be recovered. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None

        Aliases                      none

NAME

DESCRIPTION
    Deletes one or more directory exports. If any of the `ExportName` is not unique across the system, `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` must be specified to determine the exports.

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryId <List<String>>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the unique local member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. For local group IDs refer to group IDs (GID). For local user IDs refer to user IDs (UID). The `MemberId` and `MemberName` parameters cannot be provided together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberSid <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the specified member SID. Enter multiple member SIDs. For example, `S-1-2-532-582374278-329482934,S-1-2-532-234235245-423425234`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberSids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberType <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the member types specified. The type of member is the full name of the resource endpoint. Valid values include `directories`. Enter multiple member types. For example, `type01,type02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberTypes
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Delete directory snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a directory snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated directory snapshots cannot be recovered. Directory snapshots are destroyed by using the Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]
        Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      cf
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Eradicate [<SwitchParameter>]
        Permanently delete DirectorySnapshot
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Position?                    named

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      wi
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Unreachable <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allows a one-sided disconnect when the connection status is `connecting` instead of `connected` or `partially connected`. If set to `$False`, it works just like normal coordinated disconnect. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Host
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Delete a host
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2Host [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes an existing host. All volumes that are connected to the host, either through private or shared connections, must be disconnected from the host before the host can be deleted. The `Name` query parameter is required.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>

        Required?                    false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2HostGroupHost
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a membership from a host group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2HostGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a membership from a host group. Removing a membership from a host group automatically disconnects the host from all volumes associated with the group. Hosts can be removed from host groups at any time. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together, and only one host group can be specified at a time.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a host group from a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2HostGroupProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a host group member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed are not affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Pod
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a pod
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2Pod [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-EradicateContents <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes (eradicates) a pod that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated pods cannot be recovered. Pods are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2Pod` cmdlet. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. If SafeMode is enabled then `Update-Pfa2Pod -DestroyContents $True -Destroyed $True` must be called first.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
