NAME
    Remove-Pfa2PodArray
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a pod that was stretched to an array
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2PodArray [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-WithUnknown <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a pod that was stretchd to an array, collapsing the pod to a single array. Unstretch a pod from an array when the volumes within the stretched pod no longer need to be synchronously replicated between the two arrays. After a pod has been unstretched, synchronous replication stops. A destroyed version of the pod with 'restretch' appended to the pod name is created on the array that no longer has the pod. The restretched pod represents a point-in-time snapshot of the pod, just before it was unstretched. The restretch pod enters an eradication pending period starting from the time that the pod was unstretched. A restretched pod can be cloned or destroyed, but it cannot be explicitly recovered. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the pod to be unstretched. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array from which the pod is to be unstretched. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together. (Deprecated) Use pods/members instead.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WithUnknown <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, unstretches the specified pod from the specified array by force. Use the `WithUnknown` parameter in the following rare event: the local array goes offline while the pod is still stretched across two arrays, the status of the remote array becomes unknown, and there is no guarantee that the pod is online elsewhere.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2PodReplicaLink
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) Delete pod replica links
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes pod replica links. The `LocalPodName` and `RemotePodName` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

    -Id <List<String>>

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -LocalPodId <List<String>>

        Required?                    false

        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -LocalPodName <List<String>>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None

        Aliases                      LocalPodNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      RemotePodIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2PolicyQuotaMember [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-MemberType <List<String>>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a membership between one or more quota policies and managed directories. The `PolicyId` or `PolicyName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but cannot be set together.

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a protection group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated protection groups cannot be recovered. Protection groups are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup` method. The `Name` parameter is required.

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a host from a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupHost [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a host member from a protection group. After the member has been removed, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was removed will not be affected. Removing a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the host. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a protection group snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a protection group snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicating a protection group snapshot eradicates all of its protection group snapshots and cannot be recovered. Protection group snapshots are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot` method. The `Name` or `Id` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a target from a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes an array, pod, or offload target from a protection group. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `MemberName` parameter represents the name of the array, pod, or offload target that is being removed from the protection group. The `GroupName` and `MemberName` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a volume from a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2ProtectionGroupVolume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a volume member from a protection group. After the member has been deleted, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was deleted are not affected. Deleting a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` parameter, and either the `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Realm

SYNTAX

DESCRIPTION
    Deletes realms that have been destroyed and are pending eradication. Eradicated realms cannot be recovered. Realms are destroyed using the Update-Pfa2Realm method.

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a remote protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a remote protection group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated remote protection groups cannot be recovered. Remote protection groups are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup` method. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Id` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.4+) Delete a remote volume snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a remote volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated remote volume snapshots cannot be recovered. Remote volume snapshots are destroyed through the `Update-Pfa2RemoteVolumeSnapshot` method. The `Name` parameter represents the name of the volume snapshot. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Name` and `On` parameters are required and must be used together.

    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Aliases                      cf
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Permanently delete RemoteVolumeSnapshot

        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]
        Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
        
        Required?                    false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Software
    
SYNOPSIS

SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2Software [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Name <String>] [-SoftwareVersion <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a software package specified by software name and version. A software package being used for an installation can be deleted if the installation is `downloading`, `downloaded`, `aborted`, or `finished`. If the software package is currently `downloading`, the download will be cancelled.

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2VchostCertificate
    
SYNOPSIS
    Delete a vchost certificate
    
    
SYNTAX

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2VchostConnection
    
SYNOPSIS
    Delete the vchost-connection between a protocol endpoint and its vchost
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2VchostConnection [-AllVchosts <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>] [-ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>] [-VchostId <List<String>>] [-VchostName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes the vchost-connection between a protocol endpoint and its vchost. The storage container represented by the protocol endpoint will no longer be visible to the vCenter represented by the vchost. One of the `ProtocolEndpointName` or `ProtocolEndpointId` query parameters, and one of the `VchostName` or `VchostId` query parameters are required. But if `AllVchosts` is set to `$True`, `VchostName` and `VchostId` should not be specified.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AllVchosts <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the storage container represented by the protocol endpoint is accessible to all vchosts. Users should not specify `VchostId` or `VchostName` in the request. If set to `$False`, the storage container represented by the protocol endpoint is only accessible to the vchosts that have explicit vchost-connections with the protocol endpoint. Users need to specify `VchostId` or `VchostName` in the request.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointId <List<String>>
        A list of protocol endpoint IDs. Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. For example, `peid01,peid02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `ProtocolEndpointName`. If the list contains more than one value, then `VchostId` or `VchostName` must have exactly one value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ProtocolEndpointIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtocolEndpointName <List<String>>
        A list of protocol endpoint names. Performs the operation on the protocol endpoints specified. For example, `pe01,pe02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `ProtocolEndpointId`. If the list contains more than one value, then `VchostId` or `VchostName` must have exactly one value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ProtocolEndpointNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VchostId <List<String>>
        A list of vchost IDs. Performs the operation on the vchosts specified. For example, `vchostid01,vchostid02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `VchostName`. If the list contains more than one value, then `ProtocolEndpointId` or `ProtocolEndpointName` must have exactly one value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VchostIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VchostName <List<String>>
        A list of vchost names. Performs the operation on the vchosts specified. For example, `vchost01,vchost02`. Cannot be used in conjunction with `VchostId`. If the list contains more than one value, then `ProtocolEndpointId` or `ProtocolEndpointName` must have exactly one value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VchostNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Volume
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Delete a volume
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2Volume [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes (eradicates) a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated volumes cannot be recovered. Volumes are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2Volume` cmdlet. The `Ids` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]
        Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      cf
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Eradicate [<SwitchParameter>]
        Permanently delete Volume

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Delete a volume from a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2VolumeProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a volume member from a protection group. After the member has been deleted, it is no longer protected by the group. Any protection group snapshots that were taken before the member was deleted are not affected. Deleting a member from a protection group does not delete the member from the array, and the member can be added back to the protection group at any time. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group, and the `MemberName` and `MemberId` parameters represent the names or IDs of the volume. The `GroupName` and only one of `MemberName` or `MemberId` parameters are required and must be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME

    Deletes a volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated volume snapshots cannot be recovered. Volume snapshots are destroyed by using the `Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot` method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

NAME
    Remove-Pfa2Workload
    
SYNOPSIS
    Delete a workload
    
    
SYNTAX
    Remove-Pfa2Workload [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Confirm] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Eradicate] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WhatIf] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Deletes a workload that has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Eradicated workloads cannot be recovered. Workloads are destroyed using the `Update-Pfa2Workload` method. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]
        Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      cf
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Eradicate [<SwitchParameter>]
        Permanently delete Workload
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource names specified. Only one value is supported.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]
        Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      wi
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}

        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    Set-Pfa2Logging
    
SYNOPSIS
    Control logging to a named file.
    
    
SYNTAX
    Set-Pfa2Logging [[-LogFilename] <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Set logging of all Pure Storage PowerShell SDK activity to a file.
    

PARAMETERS
    -LogFilename <String>
        Path to the file. Set to empty string or null to turn off logging. Logs will always be appended to the end of the file.

        Position?                    0
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

NAME
    Set-Pfa2PresetWorkload
    
SYNOPSIS
    Update a workload preset
    
    
SYNTAX
    Set-Pfa2PresetWorkload [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Description <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ParametersConstraintsBooleanDefault <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerAllowedValues <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerDefault <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMaximum <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsIntegerMinimum <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceAllowedValuesResourceType <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultId <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultName <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsResourceReferenceDefaultResourceType <List<String>>] [-ParametersConstraintsStringAllowedValues <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-ParametersConstraintsStringDefault <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataDescription <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataDisplayName <List<String>>] [-ParametersMetadataSubtype <List<String>>] [-ParametersName <List<String>>] [-ParametersType <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRemoteTargets <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery <List<String>>] [-PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsQosConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassId <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassName <List<String>>] [-PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassResourceType <List<String>>] [-PresetName <String>] [-QosConfigurationsBandwidthLimit <List<String>>] [-QosConfigurationsIopsLimit <List<String>>] [-QosConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesAt <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesEvery <List<String>>] [-SnapshotConfigurationsRulesKeepFor <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsCount <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsName <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsPeriodicReplicationConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-VolumeConfigurationsPlacementConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-VolumeConfigurationsProvisionedSize <List<String>>] [-VolumeConfigurationsSnapshotConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>] [-WorkloadTagsCopyable <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsKey <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsNamespace <List<String>>] [-WorkloadTagsValue <List<String>>] [-WorkloadType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Updates a workload preset by replacing it with the new contents in `preset`. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Description <String>
        A brief description of the workload the preset will configure. Supports up to 1KB of unicode characters.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        The subtype of the parameter, which the GUI will use to contextualize the prompt for the parameter value. For example, when set to size, the GUI will display an input field with a dropdown menu that contains common size units such as MB, GB, TB, etc. Valid values include `size`, `iops`, `bandwidth`, `time` and `duration`. Subtype can only be used with integer parameters.
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadMetadata
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named

        Accept pipeline input?       False

    -ParametersName <List<String>>
        The name of the parameter, by which other fields in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all parameters in the preset.
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadParameter
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ParametersType <List<String>>
        The type of the parameter. Valid values include `string`, `integer`, `boolean` and `resource_reference`.  String parameters can be used to collect metadata about workloads deployed from the preset, such as the environment to which they are deployed (e.g., production, development, etc.) or the billing account to which they belong for charge back and show back purposes.  Integer and boolean parameters can be used to configure specific fields in the preset, such as the number or size of volumes to provision.  Resource reference parameters can be used to collect references to other objects, such as storage classes or remote arrays.
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadParameter
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsName <List<String>>
        The name of the periodic replication configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadPeriodicReplicationConfiguration
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRemoteTargets <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>
        The remote targets to which snapshots may be replicated. Provide 1 value(s).
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadPeriodicReplicationConfiguration
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt <List<String>>
        ">Specifies the number of milliseconds since midnight at which to take a snapshot. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value cannot be set if the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value is not measured in days. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value can only be set on the first rule.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery <List<String>>
        ">Specifies the interval between snapshots, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value for all rules must be multiples of one another. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and 400 days for the first rule. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and one day for the second rule.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor <List<String>>
        ">Specifies the period that snapshots are retained before they are eradicated, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 24855 days for the first rule, and a multiple of a second. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 2147483647 days for the second rule, and must be greater than or equal to the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value of the first rule.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PlacementConfigurationsName <List<String>>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PlacementConfigurationsQosConfigurations <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.String]]>

        reference: PresetWorkloadPlacementConfiguration
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PlacementConfigurationsStorageClassResourceType <List<String>>
        Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.

    -QosConfigurationsBandwidthLimit <List<String>>
        The QoS IOPs limit shared across all volumes in the placement. Between 100 and 100000000, inclusive. Supports parameterization.
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosConfigurationsIopsLimit <List<String>>
        The maximum QoS bandwidth limit shared across all volumes in the placement. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Between 1MB/s and 512 GB/s, inclusive. Supports parameterization.
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosConfigurationsName <List<String>>
        The name of the QoS configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadQosConfiguration
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SnapshotConfigurationsName <List<String>>
        The name of the snapshot configuration, by which other configuration objects in the preset can reference it. Name must be unique across all configuration objects in the preset.
        
        reference: PresetWorkloadSnapshotConfiguration
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SnapshotConfigurationsRulesAt <List<String>>
        ">Specifies the number of milliseconds since midnight at which to take a snapshot. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value cannot be set if the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value is not measured in days. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesAt` value can only be set on the first rule.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SnapshotConfigurationsRulesEvery <List<String>>
        ">Specifies the interval between snapshots, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value for all rules must be multiples of one another. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and 400 days for the first rule. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesEvery` value must be between five minutes and one day for the second rule.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SnapshotConfigurationsRulesKeepFor <List<String>>
        ">Specifies the period that snapshots are retained before they are eradicated, in milliseconds. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 24855 days for the first rule, and a multiple of a second. The `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value must be between 10 minutes and 2147483647 days for the second rule, and must be greater than or equal to the `PeriodicReplicationConfigurationsRulesKeepFor` value of the first rule.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeConfigurationsCount <List<String>>

NAME
    Set-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTagBatch
    
SYNOPSIS
    Update tags
    
    
SYNTAX
    Set-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTagBatch [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-ResourceId <List<String>>] [-ResourceName <List<String>>] [-TagCopyable <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-TagKey <List<String>>] [-TagNamespace <List<String>>] [-TagResourceId <List<String>>] [-TagResourceName <List<String>>] [-TagValue <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Updates tags for all specified objects.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.

NAME

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -LockoutDuration <Int64>
        The lockout duration, in milliseconds, if a user is locked out after reaching the maximum number of login attempts. Ranges from 1 second to 90 days.
        
        minimum: 1000
        
        maximum: 7776000000
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        minimum: 1
        
        maximum: 20

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2ArrayCloudCapacity
    
SYNOPSIS
    Modify CBS array capacity
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2ArrayCloudCapacity [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-RequestedCapacity <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies the raw capacity of the CBS array. This should trigger a backend process that will update the CBS array capacity. The array capacity can be updated only to values defined by the capacity steps endpoint. When an existing capacity update request is in progress, any new request to update of the capacity will receive an error response. For non-CBS arrays, this feature is not supported and requests will receive an error response.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RequestedCapacity <Int64>
        The requested raw capacity of the CBS array in bytes. When the capacity update process finishes, it should be the same as `current_capacity`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
