NAME
    Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.4+) Modify an array connection
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ConnectionKey <String>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DefaultLimit <Int64>] [-Encryption <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-ManagementAddress <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Refresh <Boolean>] [-RenewEncryptionKey <Boolean>] [-ReplicationAddress <List<String>>] [-ThrottleDefaultLimit <Int64>] [-ThrottleWindowEnd <Int64>] [-ThrottleWindowLimit <Int64>] [-ThrottleWindowStart <Int64>] [-Type <String>] [-WindowEnd <Int64>] [-WindowLimit <Int64>] [-WindowStart <Int64>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies attributes for an array connection.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ConnectionKey <String>
        The connection key of the target array. It is only required when `Encryption` is changed from `unencrypted` to `encrypted`, or when `Type` is changed from `async-replication` to `sync-replication`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DefaultLimit <Int64>
        Deprecated. Default maximum bandwidth threshold for outbound traffic in bytes. Once exceeded, bandwidth throttling occurs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Encryption <String>
        If `encrypted`, encryption will be enabled for all traffic over this array connection. `ConnectionKey` must be specified when encrypted is set to `$True`. If `unencrypted`, encryption will be disabled for all traffic over this array connection. If not specified, the current encryption option for the array connection will remain unchanged.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ManagementAddress <String>
        Management IP address of the target array.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Refresh <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the array will attempt to communicate with the connection peer in order to update the connection attributes on both arrays with any changes that have occurred. If set to `$True`, other array connection attributes may not be modified in requests. Default value is `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RenewEncryptionKey <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, update array connection with a new encryption key. If set to `$True`, other array connection attributes may not be modified in requests. Defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ReplicationAddress <List<String>>
        IP addresses and FQDNs of the target arrays. Configurable only when `replication_transport` is set to `ip`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ReplicationAddresses
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ThrottleDefaultLimit <Int64>
        The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only.  The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ThrottleWindowEnd <Int64>
        The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only.  The bandwidth throttling for an array connection.     -ThrottleWindowStart <Int64>
        The bandwidth throttling for an array connection. Configurable on Update-Pfa2ArrayConnection only.  The bandwidth throttling for an array connection.         Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WindowEnd <Int64>
        The window end time. Measured in milliseconds since midnight. The time must be set on the hour. (e.g., `28800000`, which is equal to 8:00 AM).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WindowLimit <Int64>
        Deprecated. Maximum bandwidth threshold for outbound traffic during the specified `WindowLimit` time range in bytes. Once exceeded, bandwidth throttling occurs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WindowStart <Int64>

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Certificate
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.4+) Modify certificates
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Certificate [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Certificate <String>] [-CommonName <String>] [-Country <String>] [-Days <Int32>] [-Email <String>] [-GenerateNewKey <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IntermediateCertificate <String>] [-Key <String>] [-KeyAlgorithm <String>] [-KeySize <Int32>] [-Locality <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Organization <String>] [-OrganizationalUnit <String>] [-Passphrase <String>] [-State <String>] [-SubjectAlternativeNames <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies certificate attributes. Modifying self-signed certificate attributes replaces the existing certificate with a new one, generated by Purity//FA, using the specified attributes.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Certificate <String>
        The text of the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CommonName <String>
        The common name field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Country <String>
        Two-letter country (ISO) code listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Days <Int32>
        The number of days that the self-signed certificate is valid. Defaults to 3650. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Email <String>
        The email field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GenerateNewKey <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, a new private key is generated when generating a new certificate with the specified attributes. This may not be set to `$True` when importing a certificate and private key, and may not be set to `$False` when generating a new self-signed certificate to replace a certificate that was imported. Default setting is `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -IntermediateCertificate <String>
        The text of the intermediate certificate chains.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Key <String>
        The text of the private key. This field can only be specified when importing a certificate and key pair.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Keys
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -KeyAlgorithm <String>
        The key algorithm used to generate the certificate. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate. Defaults to rsa if not specified. Valid values when creating a new self-signed certificate only include `rsa`, `ec`, `ed448` and `ed25519`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -KeySize <Int32>
        The size (in bits) of the private key for the certificate. Default is 2048 bits for `rsa` key_algorithm, 256 for `ec` and `ed25519`. The `ed448` default key size is 456. This field can only be specified when creating a new self-signed certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Locality <String>
        The locality field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Organization <String>
        The organization field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -OrganizationalUnit <String>
        The organizational unit field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Passphrase <String>
        The passphrase used to encrypt `Key`. This field can only be specified when importing a certificate and key pair.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -State <String>
        The state/province field listed in the certificate.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SubjectAlternativeNames <List<String>>
        The alternative names that are secured by this certificate. Alternative names may be IP addresses, DNS names, or URIs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    System.String

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Directory
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Modify a managed directory
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Directory [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DirectoryName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a managed directory. To rename a managed directory, set `name` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but cannot be set together. The `name` or `DirectoryName` parameter is required.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectoryName <String>
        The managed directory name without the file system name prefix. A full managed directory name is constructed in the form of `FILE_SYSTEM:DIR` where `FILE_SYSTEM` is the file system name and `DIR` is the value of this field.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      DirectoryNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) Modify group to management access policy mappings
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2DirectoryServiceRole [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Group <String>] [-GroupBase <String>] -Name <String> [-NewRoleName <String>] [-RoleName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies properties of one or more group to management access policy mappings. Modifying management access policies is done at `/directory-services/roles/policies/management-access` instead.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Group <String>
        Group name that contains users with the abilities granted by the associated policies.

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupBase <String>

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique names specified. For example, `GroupRoleMappingName`. Enter multiple names.

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -NewRoleName <String>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RoleName <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) This field has been deprecated.
        
        Required?                    false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Modify directory snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2DirectorySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ClientName <String>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-DirectorySnapshotName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-KeepFor <Int64>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a directory snapshot. You can destroy, recover, or update the policy or time remaining of a directory snapshot. To destroy a directory snapshot, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a directory snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. To rename a directory snapshot, set `DirectorySnapshotName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ClientName <String>
        (REST API 2.9+) The client name portion of the client-visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the value of this field, and `SUFFIX` is the suffix. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. The client name of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable. If the `DirectorySnapshotName` and `ClientName` parameters are both specified, `ClientName` must match the client name portion of `DirectorySnapshotName`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DirectorySnapshotName <String>
        (REST API 2.9+) The new name of a directory snapshot. The name of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -KeepFor <Int64>
        The amount of time to keep the snapshots, in milliseconds. Can only be set on snapshots that are not managed by any snapshot policy. Set to `""` to clear the keep_for value.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PolicyId <String>
        The snapshot policy that manages this snapshot. Set to `DirectorySnapshotName` or `PolicyId` to `""` to clear the policy.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PolicyName <String>
        The snapshot policy that manages this snapshot. Set to `DirectorySnapshotName` or `PolicyId` to `""` to clear the policy.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Suffix <String>
        (REST API 2.9+) The suffix portion of the client-visible snapshot name. A full snapshot name is constructed in the form of `DIR.CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX` where `DIR` is the managed directory name, `CLIENT_NAME` is the client name, and `SUFFIX` is the value of this field. The client-visible snapshot name is `CLIENT_NAME.SUFFIX`. The suffix of a directory snapshot managed by a snapshot policy is not changeable. If the `DirectorySnapshotName` and `Suffix` parameters are both specified, `Suffix` must match the suffix portion of `DirectorySnapshotName`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Dns
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) Modify DNS parameters
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Dns [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CaCertificateGroupId <String>] [-CaCertificateGroupName <String>] [-CaCertificateGroupResourceType <String>] [-CaCertificateId <String>] [-CaCertificateName <String>] [-CaCertificateResourceType <String>] [-DnsName <String>] [-Domain <String>] [-Name <String>] [-NameServer <List<String>>] [-Service <List<String>>] [-SourceName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies the DNS parameters of an array, including the domain suffix, the list of DNS name server IP addresses, and the list of services that DNS parameters apply to. If there is no DNS configuration beforehand new DNS configuration with 'default' name is created. If more than one DNS configuration exists, `DnsName` has to be specified to identify the DNS configuration to be modified.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CaCertificateGroupId <String>
        A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CaCertificateGroupName <String>
        The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CaCertificateGroupResourceType <String>
        Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CaCertificateId <String>
        A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CaCertificateName <String>
        The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CaCertificateResourceType <String>
        Type of the object (full name of the endpoint). Valid values are `hosts`, `host-groups`, `network-interfaces`, `pods`, `ports`, `pod-replica-links`, `subnets`, `volumes`, `volume-snapshots`, `volume-groups`, `directories`, `policies/nfs`, `policies/smb`, and `policies/snapshot`, etc.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DnsName <String>
        (REST API 2.15+) The new name for the resource.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Domain <String>
        The domain suffix to be appended by the appliance when performing DNS lookups.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        (REST API 2.15+) Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -NameServer <List<String>>
        The list of DNS servers either in the form of IP addresses or HTTPS endpoints. Domain names in HTTPS endpoints are not supported. IP addresses must be used instead. If nameservers begin with `https://`, then DNS queries will be performed over HTTPS. Otherwise, unencrypted DNS queries will be performed. Using a combination of nameservers that begin with `https://` and that do not begin with `https://` is not supported. If servers are specified with `https://` one of `ca_certificate` and `ca_certificate_group` parameters must be set.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Nameservers
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Service <List<String>>
        The list of services utilizing the DNS configuration.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Services
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <String>
        (REST API 2.15+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Update-Pfa2FileSystem
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Modify a file system
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2FileSystem [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-FileSystemName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a file system. You can rename, destroy, move, or recover a file system. To rename a file system, set `FileSystemName` to the new name. To destroy a file system, set `Destroyed=$True`. To move a file system, set 'pod' to the destination pod reference. To recover a file system that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FileSystemName <String>
        The new name for the resource.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      FileSystemNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PodId <String>
        (REST API 2.13+) The pod to move existing file systems into.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PodName <String>
        (REST API 2.13+) The pod to move existing file systems into.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Fleet
    
SYNOPSIS
    Modify a fleet
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Fleet [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-FleetName <String>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a fleet, changing its name by passing the old name in `FleetName` query parameter, and the new name in the `FleetName` parameter in the request body.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version

        Aliases                      none

        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Host
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Modify a host
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Host [-AddIqn <List<String>>] [-AddNqn <List<String>>] [-AddWwn <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ChapHostPassword <String>] [-ChapHostUser <String>] [-ChapTargetPassword <String>] [-ChapTargetUser <String>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-FromMemberId <List<String>>] [-FromMemberNames <List<String>>] [-HostGroupName <String>] [-HostName <String>] [-Iqn <List<String>>] [-ModifyResourceAccess <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Nqn <List<String>>] [-Personality <String>] [-PreferredArraysId <List<String>>] [-PreferredArraysName <List<String>>] [-RemoveIqn <List<String>>] [-RemoveNqn <List<String>>] [-RemoveWwn <List<String>>] [-ToMemberId <List<String>>] [-ToMemberName <List<String>>] [-Vlan <String>] [-Wwn <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies an existing host, including its storage network addresses, CHAP, host personality, and preferred arrays, or associate a host to a host group. The `Name` query parameter is required.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AddIqn <List<String>>
        Adds the specified iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) to those already associated with the specified host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      AddIqns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AddNqn <List<String>>
        Adds the specified NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs) to those already associated with the specified host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      AddNqns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AddWwn <List<String>>
        Adds the specified Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs) to those already associated with the specified host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      AddWwns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ChapHostPassword <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ChapHostUser <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ChapTargetPassword <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ChapTargetUser <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP). Challenge-Handshake Authentication Protocol (CHAP).
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FromMemberId <List<String>>
        Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays from which the resource should be removed. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      FromMemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FromMemberNames <List<String>>
        Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays to be removed from the specified resource. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -HostGroupName <String>
        The host group to which the host should be associated.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      HostGroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -HostName <String>
        The new name for the resource.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      HostNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Iqn <List<String>>
        The iSCSI qualified name (IQN) associated with the host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Iqns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ModifyResourceAccess <String>
        Describes how to modify a resource accesses of a resource when that resource is moved. Possible values are: `none`, `create`, and `delete`. The `none` value indicates that no resource access should be modified. The `create` value is used when a resource is moving out of a realm into the array and it needs to create a resource access of the moved resource to the realm from which it is moving. The `delete` value is used when a resource that is moving from an array into a realm already has a resource access into that realm. This is a required parameter when a resource is being moved to another member.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Nqn <List<String>>
        The NVMe Qualified Name (NQN) associated with the host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Nqns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Personality <String>
        Determines how the system tunes the array to ensure that it works optimally with the host. Set `Personality` to the name of the host operating system or virtual memory system. Valid values are `aix`, `esxi`, `hitachi-vsp`, `hpux`, `oracle-vm-server`, `solaris`, and `vms`. If your system is not listed as one of the valid host personalities, do not set the option. By default, the personality is not set.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PreferredArraysId <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.
        
        reference: Reference
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PreferredArraysName <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.
        
        reference: Reference
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RemoveIqn <List<String>>
        Disassociates the specified iSCSI Qualified Names (IQNs) from the specified host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      RemoveIqns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RemoveNqn <List<String>>
        Disassociates the specified NVMe Qualified Names (NQNs) from the specified host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      RemoveNqns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RemoveWwn <List<String>>
        Disassociates the specified Fibre Channel World Wide Names (WWNs) from the specified host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      RemoveWwns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ToMemberId <List<String>>
        The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ToMemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ToMemberName <List<String>>
        The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ToMemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Vlan <String>
        The VLAN ID that the host is associated with. If not set, there is no change in VLAN. If set to `any`, the host can access any VLAN. If set to `untagged`, the host can only access untagged VLANs. If set to a number between `1` and `4094`, the host can only access the specified VLAN with that number.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Wwn <List<String>>
        The Fibre Channel World Wide Name (WWN) associated with the host.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Wwns
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Kmip
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) Modify KMIP attributes
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Kmip [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-CaCertificate <String>] [-CertificateName <String>] [-Name <String>] [-Uri <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies one or more attributes of KMIP server objects.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Pod
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Modify a pod
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Pod [-AbortQuiesce <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-FailoverPreferencesId <List<String>>] [-FailoverPreferencesName <List<String>>] [-FromMemberId <List<String>>] [-FromMemberNames <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Mediator <String>] [-MoveWithHostGroupName <List<String>>] [-MoveWithHostName <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PromoteFrom <String>] [-Quiesce <Boolean>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-SkipQuiesce <Boolean>] [-ToMemberId <List<String>>] [-ToMemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies pod details.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AbortQuiesce <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to promote the pod when the `pod-replica-link` is in the `quiescing` state and abort when waiting for the `pod-replica-link` to complete the quiescing operation.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DestroyContents <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to destroy contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups), including eradicating containers with content.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the pod has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed pod is permanently eradicated. A pod can only be destroyed if it is empty, so before destroying a pod, ensure all volumes and protection groups inside the pod have been either moved out of the pod or destroyed. A stretched pod cannot be destroyed unless you unstretch it first. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed pod can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the pod is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FailoverPreferencesId <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) A globally unique, system-generated ID. The ID cannot be modified.
        
        reference: Reference
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FailoverPreferencesName <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) The resource name, such as volume name, pod name, snapshot name, and so on.
        
        reference: Reference
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FromMemberId <List<String>>
        Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays from which the resource should be removed. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      FromMemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -FromMemberNames <List<String>>
        Move the resource from the specified local member realm or array. This should be a union of all local realms and arrays to be removed from the specified resource. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -IgnoreUsage <Boolean>
        Set to `$True` to set a `QuotaLimit` that is lower than the existing usage. This ensures that no new volumes can be created until the existing usage drops below the `QuotaLimit`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Mediator <String>
        Sets the URL of the mediator for this pod, replacing the URL of the current mediator. By default, the Pure1 Cloud Mediator (`purestorage`) serves as the mediator.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MoveWithHostGroupName <List<String>>
        The host groups to be moved together with the pods to the specified local member realm or array. All the hosts in the host groups will also be moved. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MoveWithHostGroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MoveWithHostName <List<String>>
        The hosts to be moved together with the pods to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MoveWithHostNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PodName <String>
        A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PromoteFrom <String>
        (REST API 2.2+) The `undo-demote` pod that should be used to promote the pod. After the pod has been promoted, it will have the same data as the `undo-demote` pod and the `undo-demote` pod will be eradicated.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Quiesce <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to demote the pod after the `pod-replica-link` goes into `quiesced` state and allow the pod to become a target of the remote pod. This ensures that all local data has been replicated to the remote pod before the pod is demoted.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QuotaLimit <Int64>
        The logical quota limit of the pod, measured in bytes. Must be a multiple of 512.
        
        minimum: 1048576
        
        maximum: 4503599627370496
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RequestedPromotionState <String>
        (REST API 2.2+) Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `demoted` to demote the pod so that it can be used as a link target for continuous replication between pods. Demoted pods do not accept write requests, and a destroyed version of the pod with `undo-demote` appended to the pod name is created on the array with the state of the pod when it was in the promoted state. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `promoted` to start the process of promoting the pod. The `promotion_status` indicates when the pod has been successfully promoted. Promoted pods stop incorporating replicated data from the source pod and start accepting write requests. The replication process does not stop when the source pod continues replicating data to the pod. The space consumed by the unique replicated data is tracked by the `space.journal` field of the pod.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SkipQuiesce <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.2+) Set to `$True` to demote the pod without quiescing the `pod-replica-link` and allow the pod to become a target of the remote pod. This stops all pending replication to the remote pod.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ToMemberId <List<String>>
        The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple IDs in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ToMemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ToMemberName <List<String>>
        The resource will be moved to the specified local member realm or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      ToMemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).
