NAME
    Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) Modify pod replica links
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLink [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-Paused <Boolean>] [-RemoteId <List<String>>] [-RemoteName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies pod replica links. The `LocalPodName` and `RemotePodName` are required. Valid values are `replicating`, `baselining`, `Paused`, `unhealthy`, `quiescing`, and `quiesced`. A status of `replicating` indicates that the source array is replicating to the target array. A status of `baselining` indicates that the the initial version of the dataset is being sent. During this phase, you cannot promote the target pod. In addition, changing the link direction might trigger the `baselining` status to recur. A status of `paused ` indicates that data transfer between objects has stopped. A status of `unhealthy` indicates that the link is currently unhealthy and customers must perform some health checks to determine the cause. A status of `quiescing` indicates that the source pod is not accepting new write requests but the most recent changes to the source have not arrived on the target. A status of `quiesced` indicates that the source pod has been demoted and all changes have been replicated to the target pod.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `names` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -LocalPodId <List<String>>
        A list of local pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodName` query parameter.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      LocalPodIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -LocalPodName <List<String>>
        A list of local pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `LocalPodId` query parameter.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      LocalPodNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Paused <Boolean>
        Returns a value of `$True` if the replica link is to be created in a `Paused` state. Returns a value of `$False` if the replica link is to be created not in a `Paused` state. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RemoteId <List<String>>
        A list of remote array IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteName` query parameter.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      RemoteIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RemoteName <List<String>>
        A list of remote array names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemoteId` query parameter.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      RemoteNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RemotePodId <List<String>>
        A list of remote pod IDs. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodName` query parameter.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      RemotePodIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RemotePodName <List<String>>
        A list of remote pod names. If, after filtering, there is not at least one resource that matches each of the elements, then an error is returned. This cannot be provided together with the `RemotePodId` query parameter.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      RemotePodNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLinkMappingPolicy
    
SYNOPSIS
    Modify policy mappings
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2PodReplicaLinkMappingPolicy [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-LocalPodId <List<String>>] [-LocalPodName <List<String>>] [-Mapping <String>] [-PodReplicaLinkId <List<String>>] [-RemoteId <List<String>>] [-RemoteName <List<String>>] [-RemotePodId <List<String>>] [-RemotePodName <List<String>>] [-RemotePolicyId <List<String>>] [-RemotePolicyName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies policy mappings of a replica link. Valid `Mapping` values are `connected` and `disconnected`. `connected` indicates that the source policy and its attachments will be mirrored on the target pod. `disconnected` indicates that the associated policy and its attachments are independent from any policy on the remote. This operation can only be performed on the target side of a pod replica link.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named

NAME
    Update-Pfa2PolicyAutodir
    
SYNOPSIS
    Modify auto managed directory policies
    
    
SYNTAX

DESCRIPTION
    Modifies one or more auto managed directory policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

NAME
    Update-Pfa2PolicyNfs
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Modify NFS policies
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2PolicyNfs [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-NfsVersion <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-Security <List<String>>] [-UserMappingEnabled <Boolean>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies one or more NFS policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Enabled <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, enables the policy. If set to `$False`, disables the policy.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -NfsVersion <List<String>>
        NFS protocol version allowed for the export to set for the policy. This operation updates all rules of the specified policy. Valid values are `nfsv3` and `nfsv4`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PolicyName <String>
        The new name for the resource.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Security <List<String>>
        The security flavors to use for accessing files on this mount point. Values include `auth_sys`, `krb5`, `krb5i`, and `krb5p`. If the server does not support the requested flavor, the mount operation fails. This operation updates all rules of the specified policy. If `auth_sys`, the client is trusted to specify the identity of the user. If `krb5`, cryptographic proof of the identity of the user is provided in each RPC request. This provides strong verification of the identity of users accessing data on the server. Note that additional configuration besides adding this mount option is required to enable Kerberos security. If `krb5i`, integrity checking is added to krb5. This ensures the data has not been tampered with. If `krb5p`, integrity checking and encryption is added to `krb5`. This is the most secure setting, but it also involves the most performance overhead.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -UserMappingEnabled <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.15+) If set to `$True`, FlashArray queries the joined AD/OpenLDAP server to find the user corresponding to the incoming UID. If set to `$False`, users are defined by UID/GID pair.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

    Modifies one or more quota policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.

    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version

        Position?                    named

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -IgnoreUsage <Boolean>
        Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None

        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        The new name for the resource.
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept pipeline input?       False

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}

NAME
    Update-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.15+) Modify quota policy rules
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2PolicyQuotaRule [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyId <List<String>>] [-PolicyName <List<String>>] [-RulesEnforced <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-RulesNotifications <List<String>>] [-RulesQuotaLimit <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies quota policy rules.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -IgnoreUsage <Boolean>
        Flag used to override checks for quota management operations. If set to `$True`, directory usage is not checked against the `quota_limits` that are set. If set to `$False`, the actual logical bytes in use are prevented from exceeding the limits set on the directory. Client operations might be impacted. If the limit exceeds the quota, the client operation is not allowed. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.

        Position?                    named

        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PolicyName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the policy names specified. Enter multiple policy names. For example, `name01,name02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PolicyNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RulesEnforced <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>
        If set to `$True`, this rule describes an enforced quota. An out-of-space warning is issued if logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule. If set to `$False`, this rule describes an unenforced quota. Alerts and/or notifications are issued when logical space usage exceeds the limit value described in this rule.
        
        reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RulesNotifications <List<String>>
        Targets to notify when usage approaches the quota limit. The list of notification targets is a comma-separated string. Valid values are one or more of `user` and `group`. To notify no targets, use `none`.
        
        reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RulesQuotaLimit <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Int64]>
        Logical space limit of the quota (in bytes) assigned by the rule. This value cannot be set to 0.
        
        reference: PolicyrulequotapatchRules
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2PolicySmb
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Modify SMB policies
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2PolicySmb [-AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-ContinuousAvailabilityEnabled <Boolean>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies one or more SMB policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$False`. To enable access based enumeration, set `AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled=$True`. To disable access based enumeration, set `AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled=$False`. To enable continuous availability, set `continuous_availability=$True`. To disable continuous availability, set `continuous_availability=$False`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AccessBasedEnumerationEnabled <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, enables access based enumeration on the policy. When access based enumeration is enabled on a policy, files and folders within exports that are attached to the policy will be hidden from users who do not have permission to view them.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContinuousAvailabilityEnabled <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, enables continuous availability on the policy. When continuous availability is enabled on a policy, file shares are accessible during otherwise disruptive scenarios such as temporary network outages, controller upgrades or failovers.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2PolicySnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Modify snapshot policies
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2PolicySnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PolicyName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies one or more snapshot policies. To enable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To disable a policy, set `Enabled=$True`. To rename a policy, set `PolicyName` to the new name. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.

NAME
    Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupName <String>] [-ReplicationScheduleAt <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutEnd <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleBlackoutStart <Int64>] [-ReplicationScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-ReplicationScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-RetentionLock <String>] [-SnapshotScheduleAt <Int64>] [-SnapshotScheduleEnabled <Boolean>] [-SnapshotScheduleFrequency <Int64>] [-SourceRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionDays <Int32>] [-SourceRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionDays <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies the protection group schedules to generate and replicate snapshots to another array or to an external storage system. Renames or destroys a protection group.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        Has this protection group been destroyed? To destroy a protection group, patch to `$True`. To recover a destroyed protection group, patch to `$False`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ProtectionGroupSnapshotName <String>] [-Suffix <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a protection group snapshot so that it can be destroyed. To destroy a volume, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. The `Name` or `Id` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        Returns a value of `$True` if the protection group snapshot has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed snapshot is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed snapshot can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the snapshot is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProtectionGroupSnapshotName <String>
        A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Suffix <String>
        (REST API 2.3+) The name suffix appended to the protection group name to make up the full protection group snapshot name in the form `PGROUP.SUFFIX`. If `Suffix` is not specified, the protection group name is in the form `PGROUP.NNN`, where `NNN` is a unique monotonically increasing number. If multiple protection group snapshots are created at a time, the suffix name is appended to those snapshots.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Modify a protection group target
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2ProtectionGroupTarget [-Allowed <Boolean>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-GroupId <List<String>>] [-GroupName <List<String>>] [-MemberId <List<String>>] [-MemberName <List<String>>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies the source array to replicate protection group data to the target, or disallows the source array from replicating protection group data to the target. The `Allowed` parameter must be set from the target array. The `GroupName` parameter represents the name of the protection group. The `Allowed` and `GroupName` parameters are required and must be set together. Offload targets do not support the `Allowed` parameter.
    

PARAMETERS
    -Allowed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the target array has allowed the source array to replicate protection group data to the target array. If set to `$False`, the target array has not allowed the source array to replicate protection group data to the target.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupId <List<String>>
        A list of group IDs.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -GroupName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique group name specified. Examples of groups include host groups, pods, protection groups, and volume groups. Enter multiple names. For example, `hgroup01,hgroup02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      GroupNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberId <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member IDs specified. Enter multiple member IDs. The `MemberId` or `MemberName` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -MemberName <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique member name specified. Examples of members include volumes, hosts, host groups, and directories. Enter multiple names. For example, `vol01,vol02`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      MemberNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Realm
    
SYNOPSIS
    Modify realms
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Realm [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IgnoreUsage <Boolean>] [-Name <String>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-QuotaLimit <Int64>] [-RealmName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies realm details.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DestroyContents <Boolean>
        Set to `$True` to destroy contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups), including eradicating containers with content.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, the realm will be destroyed and pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed realm is permanently eradicated. A realm can only be destroyed if it is empty or destroy_contents is set to $True. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed realm can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the realm is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -IgnoreUsage <Boolean>
        Set to `$True` to set a `QuotaLimit` that is lower than the existing usage. This ensures that no new volumes can be created until the existing usage drops below the `QuotaLimit`. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>
        Sets QoS limits.  Sets QoS limits.
        
        minimum: 1048576
        
        maximum: 549755813888
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosIopsLimit <Int64>
        Sets QoS limits.  Sets QoS limits.
        
        minimum: 100
        
        maximum: 100000000
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QuotaLimit <Int64>
        The logical quota limit of the realm, measured in bytes.
        
        minimum: 1048576
        
        maximum: 4503599627370496
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        The new name for the resource.

NAME
    Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Modify a remote protection group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionDays <Int32>] [-TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies the snapshot retention schedule of a remote protection group. Also destroys a remote protection group from the offload target. Before the remote protection group can be destroyed, the offload target must first be removed from the protection group via the source array. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Id` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        The context in which the operation was performed. Valid values include a reference to any array which is a member of the same fleet. If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        Returns a value of `$True` if the remote protection group has been destroyed and is pending eradication. The `TimeRemaining` value displays the amount of time left until the destroyed remote protection group is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed remote protection group can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the remote protection group is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -On <String>
        Performs the operation on the target name specified. For example, `targetName01`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TargetRetentionAllForSec <Int32>
        (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TargetRetentionDays <Int32>
        (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -TargetRetentionPerDay <Int32>
        (REST API 2.3+) The retention policy for the remote protection group. The retention policy for the remote protection group.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object

NAME
    Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Modify a remote protection group snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2RemoteProtectionGroupSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-On <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a remote protection group snapshot, removing it from the offload target and destroying the snapshot. The `On` parameter represents the name of the offload target. The `Id` or `Name` parameter and the `On` parameter are required and must be used together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.

    (REST API 2.4+) Modify SMTP server attributes

DESCRIPTION
    Modifies SMTP server attributes. Values include `UserName`, `Password`, `RelayHost`, `SenderDomain`, `SenderUsername`, `SubjectPrefix`, `BodyPrefix`, `EncryptionMode`, and `SmtpName`.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -BodyPrefix <String>
        Optional string added to the beginning of the email body when sending alert email messages. HTML tags are not allowed.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -EncryptionMode <String>
        Enforces an encryption mode when sending alert email messages. Valid values are `starttls`. Use "" to clear.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Password <SecureString>
        Password for the relay host, if needed.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -RelayHost <String>
        Relay server used as a forwarding point for email sent from the array. Can be set as a hostname, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address, with optional port numbers. The expected format for IPv4 is `ddd.ddd.ddd.ddd:PORT`. The expected format for IPv6 is `xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx` or, if a port number is specified, `[xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx:xxxx]:PORT`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SenderDomain <String>
        Domain name appended to alert email messages.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SenderUsername <String>
        The local-part of the email address used when sending alert email messages.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SubjectPrefix <String>
        Optional string added to the beginning of the subject when sending alert email messages. HTML tags are not allowed.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        User name for the relay host, if needed.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.3+) Modify software upgrade
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2SoftwareInstallation [-AddOverrideChecksArgs <List<String>>] [-AddOverrideChecksName <List<String>>] [-AddOverrideChecksPersistent <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] -Command <String> -CurrentStepId <String> [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a software upgrade by continuing, retrying, or aborting it. All `override_checks` are updated before the command is issued if `add_override_checks` is present. The `override_checks` parameter is valid when `Command` is set to `continue` or `retry`.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AddOverrideChecksArgs <List<String>>
        The name of the specific check within the override check to ignore so that the system can continue with the software upgrade. The `AddOverrideChecksName` parameter of the override check must be specified with the `AddOverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, if the HostIOCheck check fails on hosts host01 and host02, the system displays a list of these host names in the failed check. To override the HostIOCheck checks for host01 and host02, set `AddOverrideChecksName=HostIOCheck`, and set `AddOverrideChecksArgs=host01,host02`. Enter multiple `AddOverrideChecksArgs`. Note that not all checks have `AddOverrideChecksArgs` values.
        
        reference: OverrideCheck
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AddOverrideChecksName <List<String>>
        The name of the upgrade check to be overridden so the software upgrade can continue if the check failed or is anticipated to fail during the upgrade process. Overriding the check forces the system to ignore the check failure and continue with the upgrade. If the check includes more specific checks that failed or are anticipated to fail, set them using the `AddOverrideChecksArgs` parameter. For example, the HostIOCheck check may include a list of hosts that have failed or are anticipated to fail the upgrade check.
        
        reference: OverrideCheck
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AddOverrideChecksPersistent <System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Boolean]>
        If set to `$True`, the system always ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check and continues with the upgrade process.  If set to `$False`, the system ignores the failure of the specified upgrade check until the upgrade check finishes and the upgrade process is continued. For example, the `continue` command is successfully issued in an `interactive` mode, or the first upgrade check step successfully finishes in a `one-click` mode.
        
        reference: OverrideCheck
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Command <String>
        A user command that interacts with the upgrade. Commands may only be issued when the upgrade is paused. Valid values are `continue`, `retry`, and `abort`. The `continue` command continues a `paused` upgrade. The `retry` command retries the previous step. The `abort` command aborts the upgrade.
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -CurrentStepId <String>
        The current step `id` of the installation.
        
        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Update-Pfa2SsoSaml2Test
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.11+) Modify provided SAML2 SSO configurations
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2SsoSaml2Test [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ArrayUrl <String>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-IdpEncryptAssertionEnabled <Boolean>] [-IdpEntityId <String>] [-IdpMetadataUrl <String>] [-IdpSignRequestEnabled <Boolean>] [-IdpUrl <String>] [-IdpVerificationCertificate <String>] [-Name <String>] [-SpDecryptionCredentialName <String>] [-SpSigningCredentialName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies the provided SAML2 SSO configurations. If the configurations with the specified `Id` or `Name` exist, the provided configurations will overwrite the existing configurations, but will not be persisted in the array.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none

    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Subnet
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.2+) Modify subnet
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Subnet [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Enabled <Boolean>] [-Gateway <String>] [-Mtu <Int32>] [-Name <String>] [-Prefix <String>] [-SubnetName <String>] [-Vlan <Int32>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies one or more specified subnet properties.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Enabled <Boolean>
        Returns a value of `$True` if subnet is enabled. Returns a value of `$False` if subnet is disabled. If not specified, defaults to `$True`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Gateway <String>
        The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the gateway through which the specified subnet is to communicate with the network.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Mtu <Int32>
        Maximum message transfer unit (packet) size for the subnet in bytes. MTU setting cannot exceed the MTU of the corresponding physical interface. If not specified, defaults to `1500`.
        
        minimum: 1280
        
        maximum: 9216
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Prefix <String>
        The IPv4 or IPv6 address to be associated with the specified subnet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SubnetName <String>
        A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Vlan <Int32>
        VLAN ID number.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

If the array is not a member of a fleet, `context` will always implicitly be set to the array that received the request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.

        Aliases                      Services
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
