NAME
    Update-Pfa2VirtualMachine
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.10+) Update a virtual machine
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2VirtualMachine [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-Id <String>] [-SourceId <String>] [-SourceName <String>] [-VmId <String>] [-VmType <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Updates a virtual machine, recovering it from the destroyed state. If the virtual machine is of type `vvol`, the `source` property of the request body must be a `recovery_context` value retrieved from the `Get-Pfa2VirtualMachine /virtual-machines` endpoint. If recovering the virtual machine will cause a conflict with an existing virtual machine, the operation will fail.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <String>
        The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system. `Id` is deprecated. Use `VmId` instead.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceId <String>
        The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -SourceName <String>
        The recovery context for the virtual machine or virtual machine snapshot being modified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      SourceNames
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VmId <String>
        (REST API 2.14+) The ID of the virtual machine to create or modify, as assigned by the external system.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      VmIds
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VmType <String>
        The type of virtual machine. The only valid value is `vvol`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    None
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
        
    
    
NOTES
    
    
        
    
    
RELATED LINKS

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Volume
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Modify a volume
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    Update-Pfa2Volume [-AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PodId <String>] [-PodName <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-ProtocolEndpointContainerVersion <String>] [-Provisioned <Int64>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>] [-RemoveFromProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>] [-RequestedPromotionState <String>] [-Truncate <Boolean>] [-VolumeGroupId <String>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-VolumeName <String>] [-WorkloadId <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a volume by renaming, destroying, or resizing it. To rename a volume, set `VolumeName` to the new name. To destroy a volume, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. Set the bandwidth and IOPS limits of a volume through the respective `QosBandwidthLimit` and `QosIopsLimit` parameter. This moves the volume into a pod or volume group through the respective `pod` or `volume_group` parameter. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -AddToProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>
        The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple ids.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -AddToProtectionGroupNames <List<String>>
        The volumes will be added to the specified protection groups along with creation or movement across pods and array. When a volume is moved, the specified protection groups must be in the target pod or array. Enter multiple names in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -RemoveFromProtectionGroupIds <List<String>>
        The volumes will be removed from the specified protection groups in the source pod or array along with the move. Enter multiple ids in a comma-separated format.
        
        Required?                    false

    -RequestedPromotionState <String>
        (REST API 2.2+) Valid values are `promoted` and `demoted`. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `demoted` to demote the volume so that the volume stops accepting write requests. Patch `RequestedPromotionState` to `promoted` to promote the volume so that the volume starts accepting write requests.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Truncate <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, reduces the size of a volume during a volume resize operation. When a volume is truncated, Purity automatically takes an undo snapshot, providing a 24-hour window during which the previous contents can be retrieved. After truncating a volume, its provisioned size can be subsequently increased, but the data in truncated sectors cannot be retrieved. If set to `$False` or not set at all and the volume is being reduced in size, the volume copy operation fails. Required if the `Provisioned` parameter is set to a volume size that is smaller than the original size.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

NAME
    Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.1+) Modify a volume group
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>] [-QosIopsLimit <Int64>] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64> [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] -QosIopsLimit <Int64> [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    Update-Pfa2VolumeGroup [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-DestroyContents <Boolean>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>] [-PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>] [-QosBandwidthLimitReset] [-QosIopsLimitReset] [-VolumeGroupName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a volume group. You can rename, destroy, recover, or set QoS limits for a volume group. To rename a volume group, set `VolumeGroupName` to the new name. To destroy a volume group, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a volume group that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. Sets the bandwidth and IOPS limits of a volume group through the respective `QosBandwidthLimit` and `QosIopsLimit` parameter. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together. Sets the priority adjustment for a volume group using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator` and `PriorityAdjustmentValue` fields.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -DestroyContents <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.3+) Set to `$True` to destroy contents (e.g., volumes, protection groups, snapshots) and containers (e.g., realms, pods, volume groups), including eradicating containers with content.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        Returns a value of `$True` if the volume group has been destroyed and is pending eradication. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed volume group can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. After the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the volume group is permanently eradicated and cannot be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        (REST API 2.3+) Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PriorityAdjustmentOperator <String>
        (REST API 2.10+) Valid values are `+`, `-`, and `=`. The values `+` and `-` may be applied to volumes and volume groups to reflect the relative importance of their workloads. Volumes and volume groups can be assigned a priority adjustment of -10, 0, or +10. In addition, volumes can be assigned values of =-10, =0, or =+10. Volumes with settings of -10, 0, +10 can be modified by the priority adjustment setting of a volume group that contains the volume. However, if a volume has a priority adjustment set with the `=` operator (for example, =+10), it retains that value and is unaffected by any volume group priority adjustment settings.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentOperator
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -PriorityAdjustmentValue <Int32>
        (REST API 2.10+) Adjust priority by the specified amount, using the `PriorityAdjustmentOperator`. Valid values are 0 and +10 for `+` and `-` operators, -10, 0, and +10 for the `=` operator.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      PriorityAdjustmentPriorityAdjustmentValue
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosBandwidthLimit <Int64>
        (REST API 2.3+) The maximum QoS bandwidth limit for the volume. Whenever throughput exceeds the bandwidth limit, throttling occurs. Measured in bytes per second. Maximum limit is 512 GB/s.
        
        minimum: 1048576
        
        maximum: 549755813888
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosBandwidthLimitReset [<SwitchParameter>]
        (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosBandwidthLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS bandwidth set for the volume group.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosIopsLimit <Int64>
        (REST API 2.3+) The QoS IOPs limit for the volume.
        
        minimum: 100
        
        maximum: 100000000
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -QosIopsLimitReset [<SwitchParameter>]
        (REST API 2.3+) Resets the QosIopsLimit setting. There will be no maximum QoS IOPs set for the volume group.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeGroupName <String>
        A user-specified name. The name must be locally unique and can be changed.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false

        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False

NAME
    Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot
    
SYNOPSIS
    (REST API 2.0+) Modify a volume snapshot
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2VolumeSnapshot [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>] [-VolumeSnapshotName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a volume snapshot by renaming, destroying, or recovering it. To rename the suffix of a volume snapshot, set `VolumeSnapshotName` to the new suffix name. To recover a volume snapshot that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$True`. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Enter multiple resource IDs. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique name specified.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ReplicationSnapshot <Boolean>
        (REST API 2.4+) If set to `$True`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots in use by replication. If set to `$False`, allow destruction/eradication of snapshots not in use by replication. If not specified, defaults to `$False`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -VolumeSnapshotName <String>
        The new name for the resource.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,

NAME
    Update-Pfa2Workload
    
SYNOPSIS
    Modify a workload
    
    
SYNTAX
    Update-Pfa2Workload [-ApiVersion <String>] [-Array <Rest2Api>] [-ContextNames <List<String>>] [-Destroyed <Boolean>] [-Id <List<String>>] [-Name <String>] [-WorkloadName <String>] [-XRequestId <String>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION
    Modifies a workload by renaming or destroying it. To rename a workload, set `WorkloadName` to the new name. To destroy a workload, set `Destroyed=$True`. To recover a workload that has been destroyed and is pending eradication, set `Destroyed=$False`. The `Id` or `Name` parameter is required, but they cannot be set together.
    

PARAMETERS
    -ApiVersion <String>
        alternative API version
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Array <Rest2Api>
        The PureArray object representing a connection to a Pure Storage FlashArray. Created using the `Connect-Pfa2Array` cmdlet.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ContextNames <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the context specified. If specified, the context names must be an array of size 1, and the single element must be the name of an array in the same fleet. If not specified, the context will default to the array that received this request.  Other parameters provided with the request, such as names of volumes or snapshots, are resolved relative to the provided `context`.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Destroyed <Boolean>
        If set to `$True`, destroys a resource. Once set to `$True`, the `TimeRemaining` value will display the amount of time left until the destroyed resource is permanently eradicated. Before the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the destroyed resource can be recovered by setting `Destroyed=$False`. Once the `TimeRemaining` period has elapsed, the resource is permanently eradicated and can no longer be recovered.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Id <List<String>>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource IDs specified. Only one value is supported.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      Ids
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -Name <String>
        Performs the operation on the unique resource names specified. Only one value is supported.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -WorkloadName <String>
        The new name for the resource.
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -XRequestId <String>
        {{ Fill XRequestId Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      none
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    -ProgressAction <ActionPreference>
        {{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
        
        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                None
        Accept pipeline input?       False
        Aliases                      proga
        Accept wildcard characters?  false
        
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). 
    
INPUTS
    System.String
        
    
    
OUTPUTS
    System.Object
